analyzed: bzang skyong / khyod ci dang ci 'dod pa dris shig dang / ngas dris pa de dang de'i lung bstan pas khyod kyi sems rangs par bya'o //
translated: The Blessed One replied to the bodhisattva Bhadrapāla, “Bhadrapāla, ask whatever you wish. I will satisfy your mind by answering your questions.”

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' bzang skyong gis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' bzang skyong gis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The bodhisattva Bhadrapāla then asked the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: gnas gang dang / spyod pa ji lta bu dang / tshul ji lta bu dang / khyad par ji lta bu dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba ji lta bu dang / brtson 'grus ji lta bu dang / rab tu zhi ba ji lta bu dang /
analyzed: gnas gang dang / spyod pa ji lta bu dang / tshul ji lta bu dang / khyad par ji lta bu dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba ji lta bu dang / brtson 'grus ji lta bu dang / rab tu zhi ba ji lta bu dang /
translated: What are the places, what are the activities, what are the ways, what are the distinctions, what are the roots of virtue, what are the kinds of diligence, what is the thorough pacification,

original: ye shes la mkhas pa ji lta bu dang / dran pa ji lta ba dang / rtogs pa ji lta bu dang / blo gros ji lta bu dang / khrel mchis pa ji lta bu dang / mos pa ji lta bu dang / go cha ji lta bus byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog ste /
analyzed: ye shes la mkhas pa ji lta bu dang / dran pa ji lta ba dang / rtogs pa ji lta bu dang / blo gros ji lta bu dang / khrel mchis pa ji lta bu dang / mos pa ji lta bu dang / go cha ji lta bus byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog ste /
translated: what is the skill in wisdom, what is the mindfulness, what is the realization, what is the intelligence, what is the lack of shame, what is the aspiration, and what is the armor by which bodhisattva great beings do not turn back from unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las mi nyams shing yongs su mi nyams pa lags /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las mi nyams shing yongs su mi nyams pa lags /
translated: How do they not decline and not fall away from unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?

original: ji ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod pas byung ba lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod pas byung ba lags /
translated: How do they arise with the conduct of the tathāgatas?

original: ji ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes la brtson 'grus sbyangs pa lags /🔽ji ltar na shes rab che ba lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes la brtson 'grus sbyangs pa lags / ji ltar na shes rab che ba lags /
translated: How does one train in the wisdom of the thus-gone ones?🔽How does one have great insight?

original: ji ltar na ye shes chen po la mkhas @285a *//
analyzed: ji ltar na ye shes chen po la mkhas @285a *//
translated: How does one become skilled in great wisdom?

original: pa lags / ji ltar na tshul khrims rnam par dag pa lags /
analyzed: pa lags / ji ltar na tshul khrims rnam par dag pa lags /
translated: How does one have pure discipline?

original: ji ltar na ji ltar thos pa'i chos rnams mi bskyud pas dran pa dang ldan pa lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na ji ltar thos pa'i chos rnams mi bskyud pas dran pa dang ldan pa lags /
translated: How does one have mindfulness by not forgetting the teachings one has heard?

original: ji ltar na dge ba'i rtsa ba ji ltar bgyis pa bzhin du skyes pas tshe rabs dran pa lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na dge ba'i rtsa ba ji ltar bgyis pa bzhin du skyes pas tshe rabs dran pa lags /
translated: How does one remember one’s past lives by being born in accordance with one’s roots of virtue?

original: ji ltar na sems can gzhan la skul bas sngon gyi gnas pa la mkhas pa lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na sems can gzhan la skul bas sngon gyi gnas pa la mkhas pa lags /
translated: How does one become skilled in past abodes by encouraging other beings?

original: ji ltar na dbang po'i khyad par la mkhas pas blo dang ldan pa lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na dbang po'i khyad par la mkhas pas blo dang ldan pa lags /
translated: How does one become intelligent by being skilled in the differences in faculties?

original: ji ltar na mtshan dang ldan pa lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na mtshan dang ldan pa lags /
translated: How does one have the marks?

original: ji ltar na sangs rgyas la blta ba dang / chos nyan pa dang / dge 'dun la bsnyen bkur bgyid pa dang mi 'bral ba lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na sangs rgyas la blta ba dang / chos nyan pa dang / dge 'dun la bsnyen bkur bgyid pa dang mi 'bral ba lags /
translated: How does one never be separated from seeing the Buddha, hearing the Dharma, and serving the Saṅgha?

original: ji ltar na 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan na bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams mthong zhing /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan na bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams mthong zhing /
translated: How is it that they see the blessed buddhas who dwell in other world systems?

original: 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas mu ma mchis par de dag gi chos kyang thos la /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas mu ma mchis par de dag gi chos kyang thos la /
translated: How is it that they hear their Dharma in infinite world systems?

original: thams cad kyang kun tu 'dzin //
analyzed: thams cad kyang kun tu 'dzin //
translated: How is it that they retain it all?

original: kun chub par bgyid /
analyzed: kun chub par bgyid /
translated: How is it that they master it?

original: gzhan la'ang rgya cher yang dag par rab tu ston pa lags /
analyzed: gzhan la'ang rgya cher yang dag par rab tu ston pa lags /
translated: How is it that they teach it extensively and authentically to others?

original: ji ltar na mi dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad sreg pas me lce lta bu lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na mi dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad sreg pas me lce lta bu lags /
translated: How is it that they burn up all the roots of nonvirtue, like a flame?

original: ji ltar na chos dkar po thams cad khong du chud pas zla ba lta bu lags ji ltar na ma rig pa'i mun pa thams cad sel bas nyi ma lta bu lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na chos dkar po thams cad khong du chud pas zla ba lta bu lags ji ltar na ma rig pa'i mun pa thams cad sel bas nyi ma lta bu lags /
translated: How is it that they are like the moon, in that they embody all virtuous qualities? How is it that they are like the sun, in that they dispel the darkness of ignorance?

original: ji ltar na dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyis 'phags pas ri bo'i dbang po'i rgyal po lta bu lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyis 'phags pas ri bo'i dbang po'i rgyal po lta bu lags /
translated: How is it that they are like the king of mountains, in that they are exalted by all their roots of virtue?

original: @285b ji ltar na 'thab mo la bzod pa mi phyed pas rdo rje lta bu lags /
analyzed: @285b ji ltar na 'thab mo la bzod pa mi phyed pas rdo rje lta bu lags /
translated: How is it that they are like a vajra, in that they are unbreakable in their patience in the face of conflict?

original: ji ltar na lhun po brtsegs pa dang mtshungs shing 'dra bas mi 'jigs pa thob pa lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na lhun po brtsegs pa dang mtshungs shing 'dra bas mi 'jigs pa thob pa lags /
translated: How is it that they are like a towering mountain and thus attain fearlessness?

original: ji ltar na spobs pa thogs pa ma mchis pas dbyangs shin tu yongs su dag pa lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na spobs pa thogs pa ma mchis pas dbyangs shin tu yongs su dag pa lags /
translated: How is it that they have a completely pure voice and thus have unimpeded eloquence?

original: ji ltar na tshig thams cad rab tu dbye ba rnam par nges pa la mkhas pas thos pa mang ba lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na tshig thams cad rab tu dbye ba rnam par nges pa la mkhas pas thos pa mang ba lags /
translated: How is it that they are very learned and thus skilled in the definitive classification of all words?

original: ji ltar na khro gnyer ma mchis la bzhin 'dzum zhing shin tu gsal ba lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na khro gnyer ma mchis la bzhin 'dzum zhing shin tu gsal ba lags /
translated: How is it that they are without frowns and have a smiling and radiant face?

original: ji ltar na 'jig rten gyi chos thams cad kyis ma gos pa lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'jig rten gyi chos thams cad kyis ma gos pa lags /
translated: How is it that they are unstained by any worldly phenomena?

original: ji ltar na 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas pa dbyangs kyis go bar bgyid /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas pa dbyangs kyis go bar bgyid /
translated: How is it that they make their voice heard in infinite world systems?

original: ji ltar na 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas mu ma mchis pa spu'i khung bu gcig tu stsal kyang sems can rnams kyis bdag cag gang du mchis pa'ang ma 'tshal la /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas mu ma mchis pa spu'i khung bu gcig tu stsal kyang sems can rnams kyis bdag cag gang du mchis pa'ang ma 'tshal la /
translated: How is it that they can place infinite and limitless world systems in a single pore without sentient beings knowing where they are,

original: bgyid pa de'ang ma 'tshal /
analyzed: bgyid pa de'ang ma 'tshal /
translated: and without them knowing that this is what is being done?

original: ji ltar na sems can yongs su smin par bgyid pas phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rnams na'ang kun tu gda' la /
analyzed: ji ltar na sems can yongs su smin par bgyid pas phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rnams na'ang kun tu gda' la /
translated: How is it that you are present in the retinue of all the thus-gone ones in the ten directions, while ripening beings?

original: gnas nas yang mi g-yo /
analyzed: gnas nas yang mi g-yo /
translated: How is it that you do not move from your abode?

original: ji ltar na skra tsam gyi khyon gcig la dga' ldan gyi gnas nas gnas pa dang / 'chi 'pho ba dang / mngal du 'jug pa dang / btsas pa dang / mngon par 'byung ba dang / dka' ba spyod pa la spyod pa dang / byang chub kyi snying por mchi ba dang /
analyzed: ji ltar na skra tsam gyi khyon gcig la dga' ldan gyi gnas nas gnas pa dang / 'chi 'pho ba dang / mngal du 'jug pa dang / btsas pa dang / mngon par 'byung ba dang / dka' ba spyod pa la spyod pa dang / byang chub kyi snying por mchi ba dang /
translated: How is it that you display the entire world system in a single pore, while remaining in the Tuṣita realm, passing away, entering the womb, being born, leaving home, practicing austerities, going to the seat of awakening,

original: bdud las rgyal ba dang / chos kyi 'khor @286a *//
analyzed: bdud las rgyal ba dang / chos kyi 'khor @286a *//
translated: conquering the māras, turning the wheel of Dharma,

original: lo rab tu bskor ba dang // yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po kun tu ston cing bstan pa gnas par kun tu bstan pa'ang ston /
analyzed: lo rab tu bskor ba dang // yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po kun tu ston cing bstan pa gnas par kun tu bstan pa'ang ston /
translated: and demonstrating great parinirvāṇa, while also displaying the teachings remaining?

original: ji ltar na sems kyi skad cig gcig gis sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa rab tu 'tshal ba lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na sems kyi skad cig gcig gis sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa rab tu 'tshal ba lags /
translated: How is it that you know the mental activity of all beings in a single instant of mind?”

original: de skad ces gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' bzang skyong la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //🔽bzang skyong / legs so //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' bzang skyong la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to // bzang skyong / legs so //
translated: When this had been said, the Blessed One said to the bodhisattva Bhadrapāla:🔽“Bhadrapāla, excellent!

original: legs so // bzang skyong /
analyzed: legs so // bzang skyong /
translated: Excellent, Bhadrapāla!

original: khyod 'di ltar skye bo mang po la phan pa dang skye bo mang po la bde ba'i phyir zhugs shing; 'jig rten la snying brtse ba dang / lha dang mi'i skye bo phal po che'i don dang / phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir 'di ltar khyod snying rje chen po dang ldan zhing /
analyzed: khyod 'di ltar skye bo mang po la phan pa dang skye bo mang po la bde ba'i phyir zhugs shing; 'jig rten la snying brtse ba dang / lha dang mi'i skye bo phal po che'i don dang / phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir 'di ltar khyod snying rje chen po dang ldan zhing /
translated: You have set out for the benefit of many people, for the happiness of many people, out of compassion for the world, for the welfare, benefit, and happiness of a great multitude of people, gods, and humans.

original: bzang skyong / khyod de bzhin gshegs pa la don 'di 'dri bar sems pa ni /🔽bzang skyong / khyod yang legs so //
analyzed: bzang skyong / khyod de bzhin gshegs pa la don 'di 'dri bar sems pa ni / bzang skyong / khyod yang legs so //
translated: Bhadrapāla, you have thought to ask the Tathāgata about this matter.🔽Bhadrapāla, you should listen carefully and keep this in mind! I will explain it.”

original: bzang skyong / de'i phyir legs par rab tu nyon la yid la zungs shig dang / ngas bshad do; ;byang chub sems dpa' bzang skyong gis bcom ldan 'das la legs so zhes gsol te /
analyzed: bzang skyong / de'i phyir legs par rab tu nyon la yid la zungs shig dang / ngas bshad do; ;byang chub sems dpa' bzang skyong gis bcom ldan 'das la legs so zhes gsol te /
translated: The bodhisattva Bhadrapāla said, “Excellent!” to the Blessed One and listened as instructed.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi ltar nyan pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi ltar nyan pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: and the Blessed One said this:

original: bzang skyong / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa sangs rgyas kyis rab tu zhi ba rnam par nges pa'i cho 'phrul zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod de //
analyzed: bzang skyong / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa sangs rgyas kyis rab tu zhi ba rnam par nges pa'i cho 'phrul zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod de //
translated: “Bhadrapāla, there is a bodhisattva practice called the samādhi of the miraculous ascertainment of peace taught by the Buddha.

original: de la gnas @286b pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni yon tan gyi khyad par 'di dag dang gzhan rnams kyang 'thob bo //
analyzed: de la gnas @286b pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni yon tan gyi khyad par 'di dag dang gzhan rnams kyang 'thob bo //
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva who abides in it attains these and other excellent qualities.

original: bzang skyong / rab tu zhi ba rnam par nges pa'i cho 'phrul zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzang skyong / rab tu zhi ba rnam par nges pa'i cho 'phrul zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: “Bhadrapāla, what is the samādhi called the miraculous ascertainment of peace?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: chos thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud pa dang / mtshan nyid rab tu rtogs pa dang / phyin ci log gi mtshan nyid yang dag par 'joms pa dang / bdag gi bag chags kyis yongs su mi 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: chos thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud pa dang / mtshan nyid rab tu rtogs pa dang / phyin ci log gi mtshan nyid yang dag par 'joms pa dang / bdag gi bag chags kyis yongs su mi 'dzin pa dang /
translated: the correct understanding of all phenomena just as they are, the realization of their characteristics, the correct destruction of the characteristics of error, and the non-grasping of one’s own habitual tendencies.

original: gzhan mi dmigs pa dang / srog la rlom sems med pa dang / 'khor ba la mi 'jug pa dang; dngos po yongs su shes pa dang / zhi gnas bsgom pa dang / lhag mthong mngon sum du byed pa dang / sems gnas pa dang /
analyzed: gzhan mi dmigs pa dang / srog la rlom sems med pa dang / 'khor ba la mi 'jug pa dang; dngos po yongs su shes pa dang / zhi gnas bsgom pa dang / lhag mthong mngon sum du byed pa dang / sems gnas pa dang /
translated: It is to not apprehend anything other. It is to not be conceited about one’s life. It is to not engage with saṃsāra. It is to understand things. It is to cultivate tranquility. It is to actualize insight. It is to have a stable mind.

original: dran pa mi g-yeng ba dang / rtog pa dang / dpyod pa nye bar zhi ba dang / dge ba'i phyogs la yang dag par bsten pa dang / mi dge ba'i phyogs sel ba dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug rab tu zhi ba dang /
analyzed: dran pa mi g-yeng ba dang / rtog pa dang / dpyod pa nye bar zhi ba dang / dge ba'i phyogs la yang dag par bsten pa dang / mi dge ba'i phyogs sel ba dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug rab tu zhi ba dang /
translated: It is to have undistracted mindfulness. It is to pacify thoughts and analysis. It is to rely on virtue. It is to eliminate nonvirtue. It is to pacify desire, anger, and ignorance.

original: ma rig pa sel ba dang / rig pa la yang dag par bsten pa dang / rgya yongs su shes pa dang / lta ba yang dag par 'joms pa dang / rnam par shes pa dang bral ba dang / ye shes 'byung ba dang / sred pa zad pa dang /
analyzed: ma rig pa sel ba dang / rig pa la yang dag par bsten pa dang / rgya yongs su shes pa dang / lta ba yang dag par 'joms pa dang / rnam par shes pa dang bral ba dang / ye shes 'byung ba dang / sred pa zad pa dang /
translated: It is to eliminate ignorance. It is to rely on knowledge. It is to understand seals. It is to conquer views. It is to be free from consciousness. It is to give rise to wisdom. It is to exhaust craving.

original: dga' ba'i 'dod chags spong ba dang / sangs rgyas la gcig tu nges pa dang / chos la nem nur med pa dang / dge 'dun la rnam @287a *//🔽par mi rtog pa dang / mi 'byed pa'i tshig dang mthun par sdums byed pa dang / dben pa la gzhol pa dang / bka' blo bde ba dang / mu cor du mi smra ba dang / zang zing med pa dang / kha na ma tho ba spong ba dang /
analyzed: dga' ba'i 'dod chags spong ba dang / sangs rgyas la gcig tu nges pa dang / chos la nem nur med pa dang / dge 'dun la rnam @287a *// par mi rtog pa dang / mi 'byed pa'i tshig dang mthun par sdums byed pa dang / dben pa la gzhol pa dang / bka' blo bde ba dang / mu cor du mi smra ba dang / zang zing med pa dang / kha na ma tho ba spong ba dang /
translated: It is to abandon the desire for joy. It is to be certain about the Buddha. It is to be without doubt about the Dharma. It is to be without concepts about the Saṅgha. It is to reconcile those who are divided by speaking in harmony. It is to be dedicated to solitude. It is to be agreeable. It is to not speak nonsense. It is to be without material desires. It is to abandon what is reprehensible.

original: sdig pa thams cad mi byed pa dang / 'bral ba mdun du byed pa dang / 'du ba mi byed pa dang / 'jig rten gyi ya mtshan la mngon par dga' ba med pa dang / 'khor ba la nyes dmigs su lta ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la phan yon du lta ba dang /
analyzed: sdig pa thams cad mi byed pa dang / 'bral ba mdun du byed pa dang / 'du ba mi byed pa dang / 'jig rten gyi ya mtshan la mngon par dga' ba med pa dang / 'khor ba la nyes dmigs su lta ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la phan yon du lta ba dang /
translated: It is to not commit any negative actions. It is to be free. It is to not gather. It is to not delight in the wonders of the world. It is to see the flaws of saṃsāra. It is to see the benefits of nirvāṇa.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pas yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings 'dod pa dang / g-yo med pa dang / gya gyu med pa dang / sgyu med pa dang / tshul 'chos pa med pa dang / kha gsag med pa dang / gzhog slongs med pa dang /
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pas yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings 'dod pa dang / g-yo med pa dang / gya gyu med pa dang / sgyu med pa dang / tshul 'chos pa med pa dang / kha gsag med pa dang / gzhog slongs med pa dang /
translated: They are those who wish for the realm of the transcendence of suffering with a higher motivation, who are without deceit, without dishonesty, without pretense, without hypocrisy, without flattery, without arrogance,

original: thob kyis 'jal ba med pa dang / rnyed pa dang bkur sti yongs su spong ba dang / brtson 'grus brtsams pa dang / shin tu bzod pa dang / le lo med pa dang / sgrib pa spong ba dang / dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dang ldan pa dang /
analyzed: thob kyis 'jal ba med pa dang / rnyed pa dang bkur sti yongs su spong ba dang / brtson 'grus brtsams pa dang / shin tu bzod pa dang / le lo med pa dang / sgrib pa spong ba dang / dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dang ldan pa dang /
translated: without presumption, who give up gain and honor, who are diligent, who are very patient, who are not lazy, who abandon obscurations, who have the ten virtuous actions,

original: tshul khrims kyi phung po skyon med pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po las mi g-yo ba dang; ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la mi gnas pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pas mi ngoms pa dang /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi phung po skyon med pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po las mi g-yo ba dang; ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la mi gnas pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pas mi ngoms pa dang /
translated: who have the faultless aggregate of discipline, who do not waver from the aggregate of samādhi, who do not abide in samādhi and meditative absorption, and who are insatiable in perfecting the perfections.

original: bsam gtan dang / @287b rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pas rnam par 'phrul pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pas ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du rnam par rtsen pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la dbang sgyur ba dang /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / @287b rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pas rnam par 'phrul pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pas ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du rnam par rtsen pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la dbang sgyur ba dang /
translated: They are the emanations of concentration, liberation, absorption, and samādhi; the play of the bases of miraculous power; the attainment of omniscient wisdom;

original: blo tha dad pa med pa dang / bems po ma yin pa dang / mi 'on mi lkugs pa dang / gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog pa dang / kun nas mnar sems kyi dngos po rnam par spong ba dang / skyes bu dam pa'i gnas thob pa dang /
analyzed: blo tha dad pa med pa dang / bems po ma yin pa dang / mi 'on mi lkugs pa dang / gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog pa dang / kun nas mnar sems kyi dngos po rnam par spong ba dang / skyes bu dam pa'i gnas thob pa dang /
translated: the absence of a different mind; the absence of being inanimate; the absence of being deaf or mute; the absence of being dependent on others; the absence of the basis of malice; and the attainment of the state of a holy being.

original: skyes bu ngan pa la mi lta ba dang / byis pa rnams rnam par spong ba dang / mkhas pa dang 'grogs pa dang / dran pa'i stobs bskyed pa dang / ye shes kyi stobs bskyed pa dang / khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba rnams dang mi 'dre ba dang /
analyzed: skyes bu ngan pa la mi lta ba dang / byis pa rnams rnam par spong ba dang / mkhas pa dang 'grogs pa dang / dran pa'i stobs bskyed pa dang / ye shes kyi stobs bskyed pa dang / khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba rnams dang mi 'dre ba dang /
translated: They are the absence of looking at evil beings; the abandonment of childish beings; the company of the wise; the development of the power of mindfulness; the development of the power of wisdom; the absence of association with householders and renunciants;

original: dben pa la gnas pa dang / stong pa nyid dang; mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / chos rnams la bzod pa dang / chos thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: dben pa la gnas pa dang / stong pa nyid dang; mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / chos rnams la bzod pa dang / chos thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu rtogs pa ste /
translated: and the realization of all phenomena as they are.

original: 'di ni / bzang skyong /
analyzed: 'di ni / bzang skyong /
translated: Bhadrapāla,

original: rab tu zhi ba rnam par nges pa'i cho 'phrul zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: rab tu zhi ba rnam par nges pa'i cho 'phrul zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya ba ste /
translated: this is called the absorption that is a magical display of total peace and ascertainment.

original: ting nge 'dzin 'di la slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni chos thams cad la sgrib pa med pas shes pa 'thob bo //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin 'di la slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni chos thams cad la sgrib pa med pas shes pa 'thob bo //
translated: Bodhisattvas who train in this absorption will attain unobstructed knowledge of all phenomena.

original: bzang skyong / gzhan yang rab tu zhi ba rnam par nges pa'i cho 'phrul gyi ting nge 'dzin ces bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bzang skyong / gzhan yang rab tu zhi ba rnam par nges pa'i cho 'phrul gyi ting nge 'dzin ces bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: “Moreover, Bhadrapāla, the absorption that is a magical display of total peace and ascertainment is as follows:

original: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du shes pa dang / tshig @288a *//
analyzed: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du shes pa dang / tshig @288a *//
translated: It is the knowledge of the sameness of all phenomena,🔽and the knowledge of the sameness of all words.

original: thams cad la mtshams sbyar bar shes pa dang / khyim gyi dngos po yongs su gtong ba dang / khams gsum la mngon par mi dga' ba dang / sems ma zhum pa dang / chos thams cad la mngon par ma zhen pa dang / dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: thams cad la mtshams sbyar bar shes pa dang / khyim gyi dngos po yongs su gtong ba dang / khams gsum la mngon par mi dga' ba dang / sems ma zhum pa dang / chos thams cad la mngon par ma zhen pa dang / dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin pa dang /
translated: “It is to know how to connect with everything. It is to give away all possessions. It is to have no fondness for the three realms. It is to have an undaunted mind. It is to not cling to any phenomena. It is to uphold the sublime Dharma.

original: chos sbed pa dang / las kyi rnam par smin pa la yid ches pa dang 'dul ba la mkhas pa dang / rtsod pa nye bar zhi ba dang / 'thab pa med pa dang / 'gyed pa med pa dang / bzod pa yang dag par 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: chos sbed pa dang / las kyi rnam par smin pa la yid ches pa dang 'dul ba la mkhas pa dang / rtsod pa nye bar zhi ba dang / 'thab pa med pa dang / 'gyed pa med pa dang / bzod pa yang dag par 'dzin pa dang /
translated: It is to conceal the Dharma. It is to have confidence in the ripening of karma. It is to be skilled in the vinaya. It is to pacify disputes. It is to be without conflict. It is to be without contention. It is to uphold patience.

original: rtogs pa yang dag par 'dzin pa dang / rtogs pa mnyam pa nyid dang / chos nyid rab tu dbye ba la mkhas pa dang / chos gtan la dbab pa la mkhas pa dang / chos kyi tshig la mkhas pa dang; chos kyi tshig rab tu dbye ba shes pa dang /
analyzed: rtogs pa yang dag par 'dzin pa dang / rtogs pa mnyam pa nyid dang / chos nyid rab tu dbye ba la mkhas pa dang / chos gtan la dbab pa la mkhas pa dang / chos kyi tshig la mkhas pa dang; chos kyi tshig rab tu dbye ba shes pa dang /
translated: It is to uphold realization. It is the sameness of realization. It is to be skilled in the classification of the nature of phenomena. It is to be skilled in ascertaining the Dharma. It is to be skilled in the words of the Dharma. It is to know the classifications of the words of the Dharma.

original: sngon gyi mtha' shes pa dang / phyi ma'i mtha' shes pa dang / da ltar byung ba shes pa dang / dus gsum mnyam pa nyid du shes pa dang / 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa shes pa dang / lus kyi gnas shes pa dang /
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' shes pa dang / phyi ma'i mtha' shes pa dang / da ltar byung ba shes pa dang / dus gsum mnyam pa nyid du shes pa dang / 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa shes pa dang / lus kyi gnas shes pa dang /
translated: It is to know the past, the future, and the present. It is to know the three times to be the same. It is to know the three spheres to be completely pure. It is to know the body.

original: sems kyi gnas shes pa dang / spyod lam srung ba shes pa dang / las rnam par dag pa dang / sgrib pa las shin tu 'da' ba dang / phung po yongs su shes pa dang / khams mnyam pa nyid du shes pa dang / skye mched sel ba dang /
analyzed: sems kyi gnas shes pa dang / spyod lam srung ba shes pa dang / las rnam par dag pa dang / sgrib pa las shin tu 'da' ba dang / phung po yongs su shes pa dang / khams mnyam pa nyid du shes pa dang / skye mched sel ba dang /
translated: It is to know the mind. It is to know how to maintain conduct. It is to have pure activity. It is to transcend obscurations. It is to know the aggregates. It is to know the elements to be the same. It is to eliminate the sense sources.

original: @288b srid pa spong ba dang / mi skye ba'i bzod pa'i bya ba 'jug pa dang / rgyu ston pa dang / las dang 'bras bu chud mi gzon pa dang / chos mthong ba dang / lam sgom pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang phrad pa dang /
analyzed: @288b srid pa spong ba dang / mi skye ba'i bzod pa'i bya ba 'jug pa dang / rgyu ston pa dang / las dang 'bras bu chud mi gzon pa dang / chos mthong ba dang / lam sgom pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang phrad pa dang /
translated: It is to abandon existence. It is to engage in the activity of accepting that phenomena are unborn. It is to teach the causes. It is to not waste karma and its results. It is to see the Dharma. It is to cultivate the path. It is to meet the thus-gone ones.

original: shes rab rno ba dang / tshig rab tu dbye ba shes pa dang / sgra yongs su shes pa dang / mchog tu dga' ba thob pa dang / chos kyi dga' ba rjes su myong ba dang / drang ba dang / mnyen pa dang / dang bde ba dang /
analyzed: shes rab rno ba dang / tshig rab tu dbye ba shes pa dang / sgra yongs su shes pa dang / mchog tu dga' ba thob pa dang / chos kyi dga' ba rjes su myong ba dang / drang ba dang / mnyen pa dang / dang bde ba dang /
translated: It is to have sharp wisdom. It is to know the distinctions of words. It is to understand sounds. It is to attain supreme joy. It is to experience the joy of the Dharma. It is to be honest, gentle, and pure.

original: khro gnyer med pa dang / des pa dang / 'grogs na bde ba dang / tshig 'jam pa dang / gsong por smra ba dang / tshur shog legs par 'ongs so zhes smra ba dang / snyom las med pa dang / bla ma la gus pa dang /
analyzed: khro gnyer med pa dang / des pa dang / 'grogs na bde ba dang / tshig 'jam pa dang / gsong por smra ba dang / tshur shog legs par 'ongs so zhes smra ba dang / snyom las med pa dang / bla ma la gus pa dang /
translated: It is to be without frowns. It is to be kind. It is to be pleasant to be with. It is to have soft speech. It is to speak pleasantly. It is to say, ‘Come here, you are welcome.’ It is to be without laziness. It is to have respect for one’s gurus.

original: bla ma la sri zhu che ba dang / skye ba la mi dga' ba dang / chos dkar pos mi ngoms pa dang / 'tsho ba rnam par dag pa dang / dgon pa'i gnas mi gtong ba dang / sa rnam par 'jog pa dang / dran pa chud mi gzon pa dang /
analyzed: bla ma la sri zhu che ba dang / skye ba la mi dga' ba dang / chos dkar pos mi ngoms pa dang / 'tsho ba rnam par dag pa dang / dgon pa'i gnas mi gtong ba dang / sa rnam par 'jog pa dang / dran pa chud mi gzon pa dang /
translated: It is to have great respect for one’s gurus. It is to dislike birth. It is to be insatiable with regard to virtuous qualities. It is to have a pure livelihood. It is to not abandon solitary places. It is to be established in the stages. It is to not waste mindfulness.

original: phung po la mkhas pa dang / khams la mkhas pa dang / skye mched la mkhas pa dang / mngon par shes pa mngon du bya ba la 'jug pa dang / nyon mongs pa sel ba dang / bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba yang dag par 'joms pa dang /
analyzed: phung po la mkhas pa dang / khams la mkhas pa dang / skye mched la mkhas pa dang / mngon par shes pa mngon du bya ba la 'jug pa dang / nyon mongs pa sel ba dang / bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba yang dag par 'joms pa dang /
translated: It is to be skilled in the aggregates, skilled in the elements, skilled in the sense sources, to engage in the manifestation of supernormal knowledge, to eliminate the afflictions, to completely destroy the latent formations,

original: khyad par du 'gro ba dang / sgom pa'i rgyu mthun pa dang / ltung ba las 'byin pa la mkhas pa dang / kun nas dkris pa rnam par gnon pa dang / bag @289a *//
analyzed: khyad par du 'gro ba dang / sgom pa'i rgyu mthun pa dang / ltung ba las 'byin pa la mkhas pa dang / kun nas dkris pa rnam par gnon pa dang / bag @289a *//
translated: to progress, to be in accord with meditation, to be skilled in emerging from downfalls, to overcome the entanglements, to abandon the latent tendencies,🔽to transcend existence, to remember one’s past lives, to be free of doubt regarding the ripening of karma, to contemplate karma, to not rely on birth,

original: la nyal ba spong ba dang / srid pa las shin tu 'da' ba dang / tshe rabs dran pa dang / las kyi rnam par smin pa la the tshom med pa dang / las la sems pa dang / skye ba la yid mi rton pa dang /
analyzed: la nyal ba spong ba dang / srid pa las shin tu 'da' ba dang / tshe rabs dran pa dang / las kyi rnam par smin pa la the tshom med pa dang / las la sems pa dang / skye ba la yid mi rton pa dang /
translated: and to be free of the mental afflictions.

original: las mngon par 'du mi byed pa dang / nang gi skye mched yid la mi byed pa dang / phyi'i skye mched rnams la kun tu mi rgyu ba dang / bdag la mi bstod pa dang / gzhan la mi smod pa dang / mi dga' ba la mi zhen pa dang /
analyzed: las mngon par 'du mi byed pa dang / nang gi skye mched yid la mi byed pa dang / phyi'i skye mched rnams la kun tu mi rgyu ba dang / bdag la mi bstod pa dang / gzhan la mi smod pa dang / mi dga' ba la mi zhen pa dang /
translated: It is to not engage in karmic action. It is to not pay attention to the inner sense sources. It is to not pursue the outer sense sources. It is to not praise oneself. It is to not disparage others. It is to not be attached to what is unpleasant.

original: so so'i skye bo la yid mi rton pa dang / tshul khrims kyi rgyu mthun pa dang / bsnyen par dka' ba dang / gzi brjid che ba dang / bdag shes pa dang / nyams pa med pa dang / spyod lam phun sum tshogs pa la gnas pa dang /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo la yid mi rton pa dang / tshul khrims kyi rgyu mthun pa dang / bsnyen par dka' ba dang / gzi brjid che ba dang / bdag shes pa dang / nyams pa med pa dang / spyod lam phun sum tshogs pa la gnas pa dang /
translated: It is to not rely on ordinary beings. It is to be in accord with discipline. It is to be difficult to get close to. It is to have great splendor. It is to be self-aware. It is to be without decline. It is to abide in perfect conduct.

original: gnod sems med pa dang / tshig mi brlang ba dang / gzhan la mi gnod pa dang / mdza' bo rjes su srung ba dang / rnam par mi 'tshe ba'i ngang tshul dang ldan pa dang / sems can la gnod pa mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: gnod sems med pa dang / tshig mi brlang ba dang / gzhan la mi gnod pa dang / mdza' bo rjes su srung ba dang / rnam par mi 'tshe ba'i ngang tshul dang ldan pa dang / sems can la gnod pa mi byed pa dang /
translated: It is to be without malice. It is to not speak harshly. It is to not harm others. It is to protect one’s friends. It is to have a nature that is nonviolent. It is to not harm beings.

original: tshig 'jam pa dang / khams gsum pa la mi gnas pa dang / gsang ba'i tshig rnams srung ba dang / chos thams cad la stong pa nyid dang mthun par bzod pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la shin tu 'dun pa dang /
analyzed: tshig 'jam pa dang / khams gsum pa la mi gnas pa dang / gsang ba'i tshig rnams srung ba dang / chos thams cad la stong pa nyid dang mthun par bzod pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la shin tu 'dun pa dang /
translated: “It is to have a gentle voice, not to abide in the three realms, to guard secret words, to have patience with all phenomena in accordance with emptiness, and to have a strong aspiration for omniscient wisdom.

original: ye shes gsal ba dang / tshul khrims brtan pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa la 'jug pa dang / @289b gcig pur dga' ba dang / cung zad shes pas chog par mi 'dzin pa dang / sems zhum pa med pa dang / lta bar gyur pa rnam par spong ba dang /
analyzed: ye shes gsal ba dang / tshul khrims brtan pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa la 'jug pa dang / @289b gcig pur dga' ba dang / cung zad shes pas chog par mi 'dzin pa dang / sems zhum pa med pa dang / lta bar gyur pa rnam par spong ba dang /
translated: “It is to have clear wisdom, stable discipline, to engage in meditative concentration, to delight in solitude, not to be satisfied with a little knowledge, to have an undaunted mind, to abandon wrong views,

original: gzungs thob pa dang / ye shes thob pa dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la nan tan byed pa dang / gtan tshigs dang rigs pa dang tshul gyi sgor gyur pa dang / 'doms pa dang / rjes su ston pa dang / spyod pa mthun par bzod pa dang /
analyzed: gzungs thob pa dang / ye shes thob pa dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la nan tan byed pa dang / gtan tshigs dang rigs pa dang tshul gyi sgor gyur pa dang / 'doms pa dang / rjes su ston pa dang / spyod pa mthun par bzod pa dang /
translated: “It is to attain dhāraṇī, to attain wisdom, to be diligent in what is possible and impossible, to be a gateway for reasoning, logic, and methods, to be patient with advice, instruction, and conduct,

original: bzod pa'i sa dang ldan pa dang / mi bzod pa med pa dang / ye shes kyi sa dang ldan pa dang / mi shes pa spong ba dang / ye shes la gnas pa dang / rnal 'byor pa'i sa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod yul ba dang /
analyzed: bzod pa'i sa dang ldan pa dang / mi bzod pa med pa dang / ye shes kyi sa dang ldan pa dang / mi shes pa spong ba dang / ye shes la gnas pa dang / rnal 'byor pa'i sa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod yul ba dang /
translated: the level of acceptance, the absence of non-acceptance, the level of wisdom, the abandonment of ignorance, the abiding in wisdom, the level of practice, the domain of bodhisattva conduct,

original: chos thams cad gyi ngo bo nyid khong du chud cing rab tu rtogs pa shes pa dang / sems nges par sems pa dang / skye bar nyid mtshams mi sbyor ba dang / nyid mtshams mi sbyor ba shes pa dang / khur bor ba dang /
analyzed: chos thams cad gyi ngo bo nyid khong du chud cing rab tu rtogs pa shes pa dang / sems nges par sems pa dang / skye bar nyid mtshams mi sbyor ba dang / nyid mtshams mi sbyor ba shes pa dang / khur bor ba dang /
translated: the understanding of the realization of the nature of all phenomena, the ascertainment of the mind, the non-linking of rebirth, the knowledge of non-linking, the laying down of the burden,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes dang / 'dod chags spong ba dang / zhe sdang dang bral ba dang / gti mug spong ba dang / rnal 'byor la brtson pa dang / mi rigs pa dang bral ba dang / dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes dang / 'dod chags spong ba dang / zhe sdang dang bral ba dang / gti mug spong ba dang / rnal 'byor la brtson pa dang / mi rigs pa dang bral ba dang / dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa dang /
translated: the wisdom of the Tathāgata, the abandonment of desire, the absence of anger, the abandonment of ignorance, the diligence in practice, the absence of impropriety, the aspiration for virtuous qualities,

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa la nan tan byed pa dang / mtshan mo mi nyal ba dang / spong ba mi gtong ba dang / chos dkar po rnams kun tu bsrung ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba ston du 'gro ba dang / thabs la mkhas pa shes pa dang /
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa la nan tan byed pa dang / mtshan mo mi nyal ba dang / spong ba mi gtong ba dang / chos dkar po rnams kun tu bsrung ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba ston du 'gro ba dang / thabs la mkhas pa shes pa dang /
translated: “It is to be diligent in superior intention, to not sleep at night, to not abandon renunciation, to protect all that is virtuous, to go forth with the roots of virtue, to know skill in means,

original: mtshan ma spong ba @290a *//
analyzed: mtshan ma spong ba @290a *//
translated: to abandon signs,

original: dang; 'du shes las ldog pa dang / mdo sde mngon par sgrub pa dang / 'dul ba la mkhas pa dang / bden pa la rnam par nges pa dang / rnam par grol ba la mngon sum du bya ba la 'jug pa dang / tshig gcig tu nges pa dang /
analyzed: dang; 'du shes las ldog pa dang / mdo sde mngon par sgrub pa dang / 'dul ba la mkhas pa dang / bden pa la rnam par nges pa dang / rnam par grol ba la mngon sum du bya ba la 'jug pa dang / tshig gcig tu nges pa dang /
translated: to turn away from perceptions, to accomplish the sūtras, to be skilled in the vinaya, to be certain about the truths, to engage in the direct realization of liberation, to be certain in a single word,🔽to speak with conviction, to see wisdom as it is, to seek learning, to be insatiable with wisdom, to have a pure mind, to have a pure body, to have pure speech,

original: gtsigs par smra ba dang / ye shes ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba dang / thos pa yongs su 'tshol ba dang / ye shes kyis mi ngoms pa dang / sems yongs su dag pa dang / lus yongs su dag pa dang / ngag yongs su dag pa dang /
analyzed: gtsigs par smra ba dang / ye shes ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba dang / thos pa yongs su 'tshol ba dang / ye shes kyis mi ngoms pa dang / sems yongs su dag pa dang / lus yongs su dag pa dang / ngag yongs su dag pa dang /
translated: and to have pure wisdom.

original: dogs pa med pa'i tshig dang / stong pa nyid la kun tu brten pa dang / mtshan ma med pa la brten pa dang / smon pa med pa ngo bo nyid kyis mi dmigs par shes pa dang / mi 'jigs pa thob pa dang / sdug bsngal ba rnams la mi brnyas pa dang /
analyzed: dogs pa med pa'i tshig dang / stong pa nyid la kun tu brten pa dang / mtshan ma med pa la brten pa dang / smon pa med pa ngo bo nyid kyis mi dmigs par shes pa dang / mi 'jigs pa thob pa dang / sdug bsngal ba rnams la mi brnyas pa dang /
translated: “It is to speak without hesitation. It is to rely on emptiness. It is to rely on the absence of marks. It is to know that the absence of wishes is not perceived in its nature. It is to attain fearlessness. It is to not despise those who are suffering.

original: de dag la nor sbyin pa dang / dbul pa rnams la khyad du mi gsod pa dang / tshul khrims 'chal pa rnams la snying brtse zhing snying rje ba'i blo dang / na ba dang / phan pa'i dngos po dang ldan pa dang / chos kyis phan 'dogs pa dang /
analyzed: de dag la nor sbyin pa dang / dbul pa rnams la khyad du mi gsod pa dang / tshul khrims 'chal pa rnams la snying brtse zhing snying rje ba'i blo dang / na ba dang / phan pa'i dngos po dang ldan pa dang / chos kyis phan 'dogs pa dang /
translated: “It is to give wealth to them. It is to not despise the poor. It is to have a mind that is loving and compassionate toward those with incorrect conduct. It is to be endowed with the things that are beneficial to the sick. It is to benefit with the Dharma.

original: zang zing yongs su gtong ba dang / tshul khrims dang ldan pa la g-yo med par bstan pa dang / bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba dang / lhag pa'i bsam pas mgron du gnyer ba dang / ji skad smras pa bzhin du byed pa dang /
analyzed: zang zing yongs su gtong ba dang / tshul khrims dang ldan pa la g-yo med par bstan pa dang / bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba dang / lhag pa'i bsam pas mgron du gnyer ba dang / ji skad smras pa bzhin du byed pa dang /
translated: “It is to give away material things. It is to teach without deceit to those with correct conduct. It is to give away all one’s possessions. It is to invite with a higher motivation. It is to do as one says.🔽“

original: phyir zhing brtson pa @290b dang; bsti stang byas pas dga' ba myong ba dang / dpe shes pa dang / sngon byung ba la mkhas pa dang / ming dang brdar brtags pa la 'jug pa shes pa dang / btags pa kun tu 'joms pa dang /🔽bkur sti byed pa la mngon par dga' ba med pa dang / bkur sti mi byed pa la btang snyoms su byed pa dang / rnyed pa don du mi gnyer ba dang / ma rnyed pas sro shi bar mi 'gyur ba dang / grags pa la mngon par 'dod pa med pa dang /
analyzed: phyir zhing brtson pa @290b dang; bsti stang byas pas dga' ba myong ba dang / dpe shes pa dang / sngon byung ba la mkhas pa dang / ming dang brdar brtags pa la 'jug pa shes pa dang / btags pa kun tu 'joms pa dang / bkur sti byed pa la mngon par dga' ba med pa dang / bkur sti mi byed pa la btang snyoms su byed pa dang / rnyed pa don du mi gnyer ba dang / ma rnyed pas sro shi bar mi 'gyur ba dang / grags pa la mngon par 'dod pa med pa dang /
translated: They are to delight in diligence and respect, to understand metaphors, to be skilled in the past, to understand the engagement with the designations of names and symbols, to destroy all designations,🔽to not delight in being honored, to be indifferent to not being honored, to not pursue gain, to not be disheartened by not gaining, to not desire fame,

original: ma grags pa la khong khro ba med pa dang / bsngags pa la rjes su chags pa med pa dang / smad pa la spa gong bar mi 'gyur ba dang / bde ba la mngon par mi chags pa dang / sdug bsngal gyis mi skyo ba dang /
analyzed: ma grags pa la khong khro ba med pa dang / bsngags pa la rjes su chags pa med pa dang / smad pa la spa gong bar mi 'gyur ba dang / bde ba la mngon par mi chags pa dang / sdug bsngal gyis mi skyo ba dang /
translated: to not be angry at not being famous, to not be attached to praise, to not be discouraged by criticism, to not be attached to happiness, and to not be discouraged by suffering.

original: 'du byed kun tu mi 'dzin pa dang / yang dag pa'i bsngags pa la mi chags pa dang / yang dag pa ma yin pa'i brjod pa dang du len pa dang / spyod yul ma yin pa rnam par spong ba dang / spyod yul la 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: 'du byed kun tu mi 'dzin pa dang / yang dag pa'i bsngags pa la mi chags pa dang / yang dag pa ma yin pa'i brjod pa dang du len pa dang / spyod yul ma yin pa rnam par spong ba dang / spyod yul la 'jug pa dang /
translated: It is to not cling to formations. It is to not be attached to correct praise. It is to accept incorrect expressions. It is to abandon what is not the domain. It is to engage in the domain.

original: cho ga phun sum tshogs pa dang / mi tshul ba rnam par spong ba dang / sems can gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba chung du la mi smod pa dang / bstan pa kun tu srung ba dang / smra ba nyung ba dang / mnyen pa dang /
analyzed: cho ga phun sum tshogs pa dang / mi tshul ba rnam par spong ba dang / sems can gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba chung du la mi smod pa dang / bstan pa kun tu srung ba dang / smra ba nyung ba dang / mnyen pa dang /
translated: It is to have perfect conduct. It is to abandon what is improper. It is to not disparage the small roots of virtue of beings. It is to protect the teachings. It is to speak little. It is to be gentle.

original: skabs kyi tshig la mkhas pa dang / phyir rgol ba tshar gcod pa dang / dus su 'gro ba dang / spyod lam brtags pa ma yin pa dang / spyod lam mdzes pa dang / don dang don ma yin pa shes pa la mkhas pa @291a *//
analyzed: skabs kyi tshig la mkhas pa dang / phyir rgol ba tshar gcod pa dang / dus su 'gro ba dang / spyod lam brtags pa ma yin pa dang / spyod lam mdzes pa dang / don dang don ma yin pa shes pa la mkhas pa @291a *//
translated: It is to be skilled in the words of the occasion. It is to defeat opponents. It is to go at the right time. It is to not be preoccupied with one’s posture. It is to have a beautiful posture. It is to be skilled in knowing what is meaningful and what is not meaningful.

original: dang / 'jig rten shes pa dang / bstan bcos shes pa dang / gsal bar smra ba dang / lag rkyong ba dang / sems shin tu 'dzin pa dang / khrel yod pa dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang / mi dge ba'i sems la smod pa dang /
analyzed: dang / 'jig rten shes pa dang / bstan bcos shes pa dang / gsal bar smra ba dang / lag rkyong ba dang / sems shin tu 'dzin pa dang / khrel yod pa dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang / mi dge ba'i sems la smod pa dang /
translated: It is to have knowledge of the world, knowledge of the treatises, to speak clearly, to be openhanded, to have a well-controlled mind, to have a sense of shame, to have a sense of decency, to be critical of nonvirtuous states of mind,

original: sbyangs pa'i yon tan mi gtong ba dang / spyod pa yang dag par 'dzin pa dang / mdzes par kun tu rgyu ba dang / bla ma la ldang ba dang / stan 'ding ba dang / nga rgyal tshar gcod pa dang / sems yang dag par 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: sbyangs pa'i yon tan mi gtong ba dang / spyod pa yang dag par 'dzin pa dang / mdzes par kun tu rgyu ba dang / bla ma la ldang ba dang / stan 'ding ba dang / nga rgyal tshar gcod pa dang / sems yang dag par 'dzin pa dang /
translated: to not abandon the qualities of training, to uphold correct conduct, to move about in a pleasing way, to rise for one’s gurus, to offer one’s seat, to conquer pride, to have a well-controlled mind,

original: don rab tu rtogs pa shes pa dang / ye shes bskyed pa dang / mi shes pa dang bral ba dang / sems la 'jug shes pa dang / sems kyi ngo bo nyid khong du chud cing shes pa dang / bsgrub pa dang mi bsgrub pa sgrub pa la mkhas pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa dang /
analyzed: don rab tu rtogs pa shes pa dang / ye shes bskyed pa dang / mi shes pa dang bral ba dang / sems la 'jug shes pa dang / sems kyi ngo bo nyid khong du chud cing shes pa dang / bsgrub pa dang mi bsgrub pa sgrub pa la mkhas pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa dang /
translated: to have knowledge of the realization of the meaning, to generate wisdom, to be free from ignorance, to know how to engage the mind, to understand and know the nature of the mind, and to have the wisdom that is skilled in accomplishing what is to be accomplished and not accomplishing what is not to be accomplished.

original: sems can thams cad kyi skad shes pa dang / nges pa'i tshig rnam par gzhag pa shes pa dang / don rnam par nges pa shes pa dang / don ma yin pa rnam par spong ba dang / bsam gtan rnams sgrub pa dang / de dag gi ro myong bar mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi skad shes pa dang / nges pa'i tshig rnam par gzhag pa shes pa dang / don rnam par nges pa shes pa dang / don ma yin pa rnam par spong ba dang / bsam gtan rnams sgrub pa dang / de dag gi ro myong bar mi byed pa dang /
translated: It is to understand the languages of all beings. It is to understand the presentation of definitions. It is to understand the ascertainment of meaning. It is to abandon what is not the meaning. It is to accomplish the dhyānas. It is not to savor them.

original: sems can thams cad kyi sems la rnam par lta zhing so sor rtog pa dang / sems can gyi dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa shes pa dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la rnam par lta ba dang / las thams cad @291b 'byed pa dang /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sems la rnam par lta zhing so sor rtog pa dang / sems can gyi dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa shes pa dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la rnam par lta ba dang / las thams cad @291b 'byed pa dang /
translated: It is to look at and discern the minds of all beings. It is to know the faculties of beings, whether they are superior or not. It is to look at what is possible and what is not possible. It is to distinguish all actions.

original: las dang rnam par smin pa med pa la 'jug pa shes pa dang / mos pa sna tshogs la 'jug pa dang / brjed ngas pa med pa dang / khams sna tshogs dang / khams du ma mngon sum du gyur pa dang / rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin kun tu mthong ba dang /
analyzed: las dang rnam par smin pa med pa la 'jug pa shes pa dang / mos pa sna tshogs la 'jug pa dang / brjed ngas pa med pa dang / khams sna tshogs dang / khams du ma mngon sum du gyur pa dang / rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin kun tu mthong ba dang /
translated: It is to know how to engage with actions and their ripening. It is to engage with the various aspirations. It is to be without forgetfulness. It is to actualize the various elements and many elements. It is to see the vajra-like samādhi.

original: tshangs pa'i dbyangs kyis ting nge 'dzin la rnam par rtsen pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad gcig pa dang / ming med pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa shes pa dang / kun tu 'gro ba'i lam shes pas lta ba dang /
analyzed: tshangs pa'i dbyangs kyis ting nge 'dzin la rnam par rtsen pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad gcig pa dang / ming med pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa shes pa dang / kun tu 'gro ba'i lam shes pas lta ba dang /
translated: the melodious voice of Brahmā, the play of samādhi, the sameness of all samādhis and absorptions, the absence of names, the knowledge of recollecting past lives, the view of the knowledge of the path that leads everywhere,🔽the knowledge of the simultaneous attainment of the exhaustion of defilements and the relinquishment of defilements, the view with the unobstructed divine eye, the play of manifesting all forms, the knowledge of engaging in the sameness of form and formlessness,

original: zag pa zad pa dang / spong ba dus gcig tu thob pa shes pa dang / lha'i mig thogs pa med pas lta ba dang / gzugs thams cad kun tu ston pas rnam par rtsen pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa mnyam pa nyid du 'jug pa shes pa dang /
analyzed: zag pa zad pa dang / spong ba dus gcig tu thob pa shes pa dang / lha'i mig thogs pa med pas lta ba dang / gzugs thams cad kun tu ston pas rnam par rtsen pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa mnyam pa nyid du 'jug pa shes pa dang /
translated: and the knowledge of the sameness of the desire and formless realms.

original: dbyangs kyi yan lag gi tshul gyi gzungs la 'jug pa shes pa dang / skad thams cad brag ca'i skad dang mtshungs pa nyid du shes pa dang / ci rigs par chos ston pa dang / sems can thams cad la legs par bshad pas tshim par byed pa dang /🔽dbang po rje ba shes pa dang / dus dang / dus ma yin par rnam par lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang rjes su 'jug pa shes pa dang / 'bras bu yod pa'i chos ston pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa dang /
analyzed: dbyangs kyi yan lag gi tshul gyi gzungs la 'jug pa shes pa dang / skad thams cad brag ca'i skad dang mtshungs pa nyid du shes pa dang / ci rigs par chos ston pa dang / sems can thams cad la legs par bshad pas tshim par byed pa dang / dbang po rje ba shes pa dang / dus dang / dus ma yin par rnam par lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang rjes su 'jug pa shes pa dang / 'bras bu yod pa'i chos ston pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa dang /
translated: It is to know how to engage in the dhāraṇī of the way of melodious speech. It is to know that all languages are like echoes. It is to teach the Dharma in the appropriate way. It is to satisfy all beings with good explanations.🔽“It is to know how to change faculties. It is to know how to look at what is timely and untimely. It is to know how to engage with the limit of reality. It is to teach the Dharma that has results. It is to perfect all the perfections.

original: @292a *// sems can thams cad yongs su 'dzin pa dang / tshar gcod pa mkhas par shes pa dang / brtags pa ma yin pa'i spyod lam dang ldan pa dang / chos kyi dbyings 'dres pa med par yang dag par 'du ba la 'jug pa shes pa dang /
analyzed: @292a *// sems can thams cad yongs su 'dzin pa dang / tshar gcod pa mkhas par shes pa dang / brtags pa ma yin pa'i spyod lam dang ldan pa dang / chos kyi dbyings 'dres pa med par yang dag par 'du ba la 'jug pa shes pa dang /
translated: It is to take care of all beings. It is to know how to be skilled in subduing. It is to have an uncontrived comportment. It is to know how to engage with the unadulterated gathering of the realm of phenomena.

original: rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / yongs su rtog pa thams cad yang dag par 'joms pa dang / skad cig gis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi zhabs drung du lus ston pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du mig yor lta bu'i lus rnam par 'phrul pa dang /
analyzed: rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / yongs su rtog pa thams cad yang dag par 'joms pa dang / skad cig gis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi zhabs drung du lus ston pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du mig yor lta bu'i lus rnam par 'phrul pa dang /
translated: It is to completely destroy all thoughts, concepts, and ideas. It is to manifest one’s body in the presence of all the thus-gone ones in an instant. It is to emanate a body that is like a reflection in all world systems.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos thams cad bstan pa kun tu 'dzin cing brjed pa med pa dang / theg pa chen po las mi nyams pa dang / theg pa thams cad kyi nges par 'byung ba ston pa la mkhas pa dang dkon mchog gsum gyi rigs yang dag par 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos thams cad bstan pa kun tu 'dzin cing brjed pa med pa dang / theg pa chen po las mi nyams pa dang / theg pa thams cad kyi nges par 'byung ba ston pa la mkhas pa dang dkon mchog gsum gyi rigs yang dag par 'dzin pa dang /
translated: It is to retain and not forget the teachings of all the thus-gone ones on all phenomena. It is to not fall from the Great Vehicle. It is to be skilled in teaching the way out of all vehicles. It is to uphold the lineage of the Three Jewels.

original: skye ba'i gnas thams cad du bya ba ci rigs par kun tu ston pa dang / phyi ma'i mtha'i bskal pa bye bar go cha gyon kyang yongs su mi skyo ba dang / sems can thams cad yongs su smin par byed ba la mkhas par shes pa dang /🔽dbyangs kyi yan lag thams cad mngon par bsgrub pa shes pa dang / bskal pa gcig bskal pa grangs med pa la 'jug pa shes pa dang / chos thams cad la mngon par 'byung ba'i gnas shes pa dang / zhing thams cad yang dag @292b par 'du ba la 'jug pa shes pa dang /
analyzed: skye ba'i gnas thams cad du bya ba ci rigs par kun tu ston pa dang / phyi ma'i mtha'i bskal pa bye bar go cha gyon kyang yongs su mi skyo ba dang / sems can thams cad yongs su smin par byed ba la mkhas par shes pa dang / dbyangs kyi yan lag thams cad mngon par bsgrub pa shes pa dang / bskal pa gcig bskal pa grangs med pa la 'jug pa shes pa dang / chos thams cad la mngon par 'byung ba'i gnas shes pa dang / zhing thams cad yang dag @292b par 'du ba la 'jug pa shes pa dang /
translated: It is to display all kinds of activities in all places of birth. It is to never tire of wearing armor for millions of future eons. It is to know how to ripen all sentient beings.🔽It is to know how to accomplish all aspects of melodious speech. It is to know how to enter a single eon into countless eons. It is to know the state of renunciation with regard to all phenomena. It is to know how to enter the gathering of all realms.

original: bskal pa grangs med pa bskal pa gcig la 'jug pa shes pa dang / zhing gcig zhing thams cad du ston pa shes pa dang / sems can gcig gi lus la sems can thams cad kyi lus yang dag par 'du ba la 'jug pa shes pa dang /
analyzed: bskal pa grangs med pa bskal pa gcig la 'jug pa shes pa dang / zhing gcig zhing thams cad du ston pa shes pa dang / sems can gcig gi lus la sems can thams cad kyi lus yang dag par 'du ba la 'jug pa shes pa dang /
translated: It is to know how to enter a single realm into all realms. It is to know how to display a single realm in all realms. It is to know how to enter the body of a single sentient being into the bodies of all sentient beings.

original: skra tsam gyi khyon gcig la sangs rgyas kyi zhing bsam gyis mi khyab pa 'jug pa shes pa dang / rang gi lus kyi spu'i khung bu'i phyogs gcig tu 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med bsam gyis mi khyab gzhal du med pa 'jug pa shes pa dang /
analyzed: skra tsam gyi khyon gcig la sangs rgyas kyi zhing bsam gyis mi khyab pa 'jug pa shes pa dang / rang gi lus kyi spu'i khung bu'i phyogs gcig tu 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med bsam gyis mi khyab gzhal du med pa 'jug pa shes pa dang /
translated: It is to know how to cause inconceivable buddha realms to appear within the space of a single hair. It is to know how to cause innumerable, inconceivable, and immeasurable world systems to appear within a single pore of one’s body.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa nyid du khong du chud cing shes pa dang / rang gi lus kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing ma lus pa thams cad rgyas par dgang ba shes pa dang / chos thams cad mtshan nyid med par rtogs par shes pa la mkhas par shes pa dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa nyid du khong du chud cing shes pa dang / rang gi lus kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing ma lus pa thams cad rgyas par dgang ba shes pa dang / chos thams cad mtshan nyid med par rtogs par shes pa la mkhas par shes pa dang /
translated: It is to understand and know that all buddha realms are the same as space. It is to know how to fill one’s body with all the buddha realms without exception. It is to know how to be skilled in the knowledge of the realization that all phenomena are without characteristics.

original: lus thams cad la lus 'jug pa shes pa dang / skad cig brjod pas skad thams cad nges par sgrog pa shes pa dang / thabs mkhas pa thams cad kyi tshul rtogs par shes pa dang / tshig gcig las brtsams te bskal pa bye ba grangs med bsam gyis mi khyab gzhal du med pa ston pa shes pa dang /
analyzed: lus thams cad la lus 'jug pa shes pa dang / skad cig brjod pas skad thams cad nges par sgrog pa shes pa dang / thabs mkhas pa thams cad kyi tshul rtogs par shes pa dang / tshig gcig las brtsams te bskal pa bye ba grangs med bsam gyis mi khyab gzhal du med pa ston pa shes pa dang /
translated: the knowledge of the body entering into all bodies, the knowledge of the certainty of the expression of all languages through the expression of one language, the knowledge of the realization of the method of all skillful means, the knowledge of teaching from one word for innumerable, inconceivable, and immeasurable millions of eons,

original: spobs pa rgyun mi chad pa dang / sgrub pa dang mi sgrub pa shes pa la rnam par dpyod pa dang / phrugs dang / cha dang / snrel zhi'i 'byed pa bstan pa shes @293a *//
analyzed: spobs pa rgyun mi chad pa dang / sgrub pa dang mi sgrub pa shes pa la rnam par dpyod pa dang / phrugs dang / cha dang / snrel zhi'i 'byed pa bstan pa shes @293a *//
translated: the uninterrupted eloquence, the analysis of the knowledge of accomplishment and nonaccomplishment, the knowledge of the teaching of the division of the forward, reverse, and cross-legged,

original: pa dang / thabs dang / shes rab chen po'i 'od zer rab tu gtong ba shes pa dang / bdud kyi lam thams cad las shin tu 'da' ba shes pa dang / lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las kyi sngon du ye shes 'gro ba dang /
analyzed: pa dang / thabs dang / shes rab chen po'i 'od zer rab tu gtong ba shes pa dang / bdud kyi lam thams cad las shin tu 'da' ba shes pa dang / lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las kyi sngon du ye shes 'gro ba dang /
translated: the knowledge of the emission of the light rays of great method and wisdom, the knowledge of transcending all the paths of Māra, and the knowledge of the body, speech, and mind being preceded by wisdom.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhis sems can gyi khams thams cad tshim par byed cing /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhis sems can gyi khams thams cad tshim par byed cing /
translated: They satisfy all beings with the four kinds of correct understanding.

original: bsod nams mngon par 'du byed pas rdzu 'phrul thob pa dang / chos kyi dbyings thams cad du rnam par 'phrul pa kun tu ston pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi sems can rnams kyi brjod pa khong du chud pa dang / phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi sems can thams cad bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis sdud pa dang /
analyzed: bsod nams mngon par 'du byed pas rdzu 'phrul thob pa dang / chos kyi dbyings thams cad du rnam par 'phrul pa kun tu ston pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi sems can rnams kyi brjod pa khong du chud pa dang / phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi sems can thams cad bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis sdud pa dang /
translated: They have attained miraculous powers through their meritorious actions, and they display their miracles throughout the entire realm of phenomena. They understand the speech of all beings in all the worlds. They gather all beings in all the worlds in the ten directions with the four means of gathering disciples.

original: sgyu ma lta bu'i chos sgrub pa la the tshom med pa dang / yo byad la dbang thob pa dang / skye ba thams cad la dbang thob pa yongs su rdzogs pa dang / tshul khrims 'chal ba dang / tshul khrims dang ldan pa mtshungs pa sbyin pa'i gnas su sems pa shes pa dang /
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu'i chos sgrub pa la the tshom med pa dang / yo byad la dbang thob pa dang / skye ba thams cad la dbang thob pa yongs su rdzogs pa dang / tshul khrims 'chal ba dang / tshul khrims dang ldan pa mtshungs pa sbyin pa'i gnas su sems pa shes pa dang /
translated: They have no doubts about the accomplishment of illusory phenomena. They have attained mastery over material things. They have perfected the attainment of mastery over all births. They know how to treat those with and without discipline equally as worthy of gifts.

original: sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa chos dang ldan pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad spu'i khung bu gcig gi 'od zer gyi dra bas khebs par byed pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi gsang ba thob pa dang /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa chos dang ldan pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad spu'i khung bu gcig gi 'od zer gyi dra bas khebs par byed pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi gsang ba thob pa dang /
translated: It is to fulfill the wishes of all beings in accordance with the Dharma. It is to cover all the worlds in the ten directions with a single strand of light. It is to attain the secrets of all bodhisattvas.

original: mtsho chen po rgya mtsho'i @293b gting tshod yangs pa shes pa dang / phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du 'od zer chen po'i dra ba rab tu gtong ba shes pa dang / sems dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang mnyam pa dang /
analyzed: mtsho chen po rgya mtsho'i @293b gting tshod yangs pa shes pa dang / phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du 'od zer chen po'i dra ba rab tu gtong ba shes pa dang / sems dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang mnyam pa dang /
translated: It is to know the depths of the great oceans. It is to know how to emit a great web of light throughout all the worlds in the ten directions. It is to be equal to the mind, water, fire, and wind.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la 'jug pa shes pa dang / tshig dang / nges pa'i tshig bstan pa thams cad la chos kyi 'khor lo skor ba dang / ma bstan par rang gis bzod pa thob pa shes pa dang / spu'i khung bu gcig nas phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du rgya mtsho'i chu'i phung po rab tu 'thor ba shes shing sems can la chus gnod pa'ang med pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la 'jug pa shes pa dang / tshig dang / nges pa'i tshig bstan pa thams cad la chos kyi 'khor lo skor ba dang / ma bstan par rang gis bzod pa thob pa shes pa dang / spu'i khung bu gcig nas phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du rgya mtsho'i chu'i phung po rab tu 'thor ba shes shing sems can la chus gnod pa'ang med pa dang /
translated: It is to know how to enter the level of the thus-gone ones, to turn the wheel of Dharma with respect to all the teachings on words and definitions, to know how to attain acceptance without being taught, and to know how to scatter the mass of water in the oceans of all the worlds in the ten directions from a single pore without harming any beings with water.

original: sems rin po che lta bu dang / nyon mongs pa'i dri ma thams cad sel ba shes pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / bsod nams tshad med pa gsog pa dus gsum du yongs su bsngo ba la mkhas pa'i cho ga shes pa dang /
analyzed: sems rin po che lta bu dang / nyon mongs pa'i dri ma thams cad sel ba shes pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / bsod nams tshad med pa gsog pa dus gsum du yongs su bsngo ba la mkhas pa'i cho ga shes pa dang /
translated: It is to know how to purify all the afflictions and to know how to accumulate roots of virtue and immeasurable merit and to be skilled in the ritual of dedicating them to the three times.

translated: It is to obtain relief through fully and perfectly awakening to all the qualities of a buddha. It is to know the emanation of the blessings of the mental activity of all beings. It is to know how to engage with all the domains of the buddhas.
