original: 'on pa / long ba thams cad la spyod lam kun tu ston pa dang / bskal pa grangs med pa se go la gcig gtogs pa srid du byin gyis rlob cing chos ston pa shes pa dang / brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten skyong ba zil gyis mnan pa'i phyir lag na rdo rje brgya stong grangs med bsam gyis mi khyab gzhal du med dpag tu med tshad med pa phyi bzhin 'brang ba dang /
analyzed: 'on pa / long ba thams cad la spyod lam kun tu ston pa dang / bskal pa grangs med pa se go la gcig gtogs pa srid du byin gyis rlob cing chos ston pa shes pa dang / brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten skyong ba zil gyis mnan pa'i phyir lag na rdo rje brgya stong grangs med bsam gyis mi khyab gzhal du med dpag tu med tshad med pa phyi bzhin 'brang ba dang /
translated: to manifest all kinds of conduct for the sake of the blind and the deaf; to know how to teach the Dharma while blessing a single sesame seed to last for countless eons; to be followed by countless, inconceivable, immeasurable, unappraisable, and innumerable hundreds of thousands of Vajrapāṇis in order to outshine Śakra, Brahmā, and the world guardians;

original: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir dbul po dang / sdug phongs pa byin gyis rlob pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byang chub rang 'byung gi ye shes la lta ba @294b mngon sum du shes pa dang / nyan thos dang /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir dbul po dang / sdug phongs pa byin gyis rlob pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byang chub rang 'byung gi ye shes la lta ba @294b mngon sum du shes pa dang / nyan thos dang /
translated: to bless the poor and the destitute in order to ripen beings; to know directly the view of the self-arisen wisdom of the enlightenment of all buddhas; to know the minds of all beings, whether they are distracted or not, and to know the past, future, and present;

original: rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi spyod lam kun tu ston pa dang / phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du phyir mi ldog pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo skor bar byin gyis rlob pa shes pa dang / sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med cing bsam gyis mi khyab pa mtshungs pa med gzhal du med de /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi spyod lam kun tu ston pa dang / phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du phyir mi ldog pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo skor bar byin gyis rlob pa shes pa dang / sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med cing bsam gyis mi khyab pa mtshungs pa med gzhal du med de /
translated: They know how to display the conduct of all solitary realizers and how to bless the turning of the irreversible wheel of Dharma in all the worlds of the ten directions.🔽In order to bring all sentient beings to full maturity, they can display the bodies of all sentient beings in a single atom and can display a single atom filling all the worlds in the infinite universes of the ten directions.🔽

original: tshad med pa'i rdul phra rab kyi rdul snyed kyi bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong dag sems kyi skad cig gcig la bstan pa thogs pa med pa shes pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi kha dog dang /
analyzed: tshad med pa'i rdul phra rab kyi rdul snyed kyi bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong dag sems kyi skad cig gcig la bstan pa thogs pa med pa shes pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi kha dog dang /
translated: the knowledge to display the conduct of all solitary realizers, the knowledge to bless the turning of the irreversible wheel of Dharma in all the worlds of the ten directions, the knowledge to display in a single instant of mind the countless, inconceivable, incomparable, immeasurable, and limitless world systems that are equal to the number of atoms in all the world systems in order to ripen all sentient beings, and the knowledge to display the colors of all śrāvakas and solitary realizers in a single pore.

original: spyod lam bskal par kun tu ston pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad rgyun mi gcod pa dang / bsam gtan mkha' khyab pa la bsam gtan byed pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir 'khor lha'i bu mo glu len cing rol mo'i dbyangs sgra dang /🔽sil snyan sna tshogs dang / pheg rdob dang / glu dbyangs len pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong dag dang / 'jig rten gyi khams rab 'byams thams cad du de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du 'gro ba shes pa dang /
analyzed: spyod lam bskal par kun tu ston pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad rgyun mi gcod pa dang / bsam gtan mkha' khyab pa la bsam gtan byed pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir 'khor lha'i bu mo glu len cing rol mo'i dbyangs sgra dang / sil snyan sna tshogs dang / pheg rdob dang / glu dbyangs len pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong dag dang / 'jig rten gyi khams rab 'byams thams cad du de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du 'gro ba shes pa dang /
translated: to display all their conduct throughout the eons; to never cease from all the bodhisattva activities in order to ripen beings; to meditate on the space-pervading concentration; to be surrounded by quintillions of celestial maidens singing songs and playing musical instruments, such as various kinds of percussion, cymbals, and flutes, in order to ripen beings;🔽to go to the assemblies of all the tathāgatas in all the infinite world systems;

original: gnas gang nas kyang g-yo ba med pa la de bzhin gshegs pa @295a *//
analyzed: gnas gang nas kyang g-yo ba med pa la de bzhin gshegs pa @295a *//
translated: to be without any movement from any abode;

original: thams cad la blta zhing bsnyen bkur bya ba dang / mchod pa'i las rgyun mi gcod pa shes pa dang / sems can mtha' yas pa yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir mthong ba dang / thos pa don yod pa 'dod cing gnas pa dang /
analyzed: thams cad la blta zhing bsnyen bkur bya ba dang / mchod pa'i las rgyun mi gcod pa shes pa dang / sems can mtha' yas pa yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir mthong ba dang / thos pa don yod pa 'dod cing gnas pa dang /
translated: It is to know how to never cease serving and venerating and making offerings to all. It is to have a view and to be inclined toward what is meaningful in terms of what is seen and heard in order to ripen infinite beings.

original: sems can yongs su smin pa rnams ji lta ba bzhin du 'dul ba'i phyir sems kyi skad cig la dga' ldan gnas na gnas pa dang / 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba dang / mngon par 'byung ba dang / dka' ba spyod pa kun tu ston pa dang /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin pa rnams ji lta ba bzhin du 'dul ba'i phyir sems kyi skad cig la dga' ldan gnas na gnas pa dang / 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba dang / mngon par 'byung ba dang / dka' ba spyod pa kun tu ston pa dang /
translated: It is to be in the Heaven of Joy, to be in a state of joy in a single instant of mind in order to tame beings who are to be ripened in accordance with their dispositions, and to demonstrate passing away, taking birth, leaving home, and practicing austerities.

original: byang chub kyi snying por 'gro ba dang / bdud 'dul ba kun tu ston pa dang / mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu skor ba dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po kun tu ston pa nas ji tsam du dam pa'i chos gnas pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub kyi snying por 'gro ba dang / bdud 'dul ba kun tu ston pa dang / mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu skor ba dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po kun tu ston pa nas ji tsam du dam pa'i chos gnas pa dang /
translated: It is to go to the seat of awakening, to demonstrate subduing Māra, to demonstrate perfect awakening, to turn the wheel of Dharma, and to demonstrate great parinirvāṇa, and to do so for as long as the sacred Dharma remains.

original: nub pa'i bar phyogs bcu thams cad kyi rdul phra rab kyi rdul snyed dag kun tu ston pa'ang shes la /
analyzed: nub pa'i bar phyogs bcu thams cad kyi rdul phra rab kyi rdul snyed dag kun tu ston pa'ang shes la /
translated: and the arising and passing away of all the atoms in the ten directions.

original: shin tu mngon par rdzogs par yang 'tshang mi rgya ba ste /
analyzed: shin tu mngon par rdzogs par yang 'tshang mi rgya ba ste /
translated: And yet, they do not fully awaken.

original: bzang skyong / 'di ni rab tu zhi ba rnam par nges pa'i cho 'phrul gyi ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o ////🔽bam po gnyis pa; bzang skyong /
analyzed: bzang skyong / 'di ni rab tu zhi ba rnam par nges pa'i cho 'phrul gyi ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //// bam po gnyis pa; bzang skyong /
translated: Bhadrapāla, this is called the absorption of the miraculous ascertainment of peace.

original: ting nge 'dzin 'di'i yongs su sbyangs pa bya ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin 'di'i yongs su sbyangs pa bya ba gang zhe na /
translated: “Bhadrapāla, what is the purification of this absorption?

original: bzang skyong / chos gang yang kun tu mi 'dzin pa /
analyzed: bzang skyong / chos gang yang kun tu mi 'dzin pa /
translated: Bhadrapāla, it is not grasping at any phenomenon,

original: mi 'dor ba /
analyzed: mi 'dor ba /
translated: not rejecting it,

original: mi 'jog pa /
analyzed: mi 'jog pa /
translated: not fixating on it,

original: 'du byed thams @295b cad rab tu zhi ba /
analyzed: 'du byed thams @295b cad rab tu zhi ba /
translated: but rather the pacification of all conditioning,

original: chos thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud pa /
translated: the realization of all phenomena as they are,

original: chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid la 'jug pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid la 'jug pa /
translated: the engagement with the sameness of all phenomena,

original: chos thams cad la mi rtog pa /🔽rnam par mi rtog pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad la mi rtog pa / rnam par mi rtog pa /
translated: the non-conceptuality with regard to all phenomena,🔽the absence of conceptualization,

original: rnam par mi sgrub pa /
analyzed: rnam par mi sgrub pa /
translated: the absence of conceptual construction,

original: kun nas mi slong ba /
analyzed: kun nas mi slong ba /
translated: the absence of motivation,

original: mi skyed pa /
analyzed: mi skyed pa /
translated: and the absence of production.

original: rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / kun tu rtog pa yang dag par gcod pa /
analyzed: rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / kun tu rtog pa yang dag par gcod pa /
translated: It is the elimination of thoughts, concepts, and discursive thoughts.🔽It is the non-attention to mental objects.

original: sems kyi dmigs pa yid la mi byed pa; rnam par shes pa yang dag par gcod pa /
analyzed: sems kyi dmigs pa yid la mi byed pa; rnam par shes pa yang dag par gcod pa /
translated: It is the elimination of consciousness.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug yang dag par gcod pa /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug yang dag par gcod pa /
translated: It is the elimination of desire, anger, and ignorance.

original: mtha' dang / mtha' med pa yid la mi byed pa /
analyzed: mtha' dang / mtha' med pa yid la mi byed pa /
translated: It is the non-attention to an end or an endless [state].

original: yid la byed pa yang dag par gcod pa /
analyzed: yid la byed pa yang dag par gcod pa /
translated: It is the elimination of attention.

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched kyi rang bzhin shes pa /
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched kyi rang bzhin shes pa /
translated: It is the knowledge of the nature of the aggregates, elements, and sense sources.

original: dran pa dang / blo gros dang / mos pa dang / rtog pa dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang / spyod pa dang / cho ga dang / spyod yul la nan tan du byed cing gnas pa /
analyzed: dran pa dang / blo gros dang / mos pa dang / rtog pa dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang / spyod pa dang / cho ga dang / spyod yul la nan tan du byed cing gnas pa /
translated: It is the practice and abiding in mindfulness, intelligence, interest, understanding, shame, conduct, discipline, and the sphere of activity.

original: nyon mongs pa med pa'i sa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa'i sa dang ldan pa /
translated: It is the possession of the stage of non-affliction.

original: zhi ba'i sa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: zhi ba'i sa dang ldan pa /
translated: It is the possession of the stage of peace.

original: spros pa thams cad yang dag par gcod pa /
analyzed: spros pa thams cad yang dag par gcod pa /
translated: It is the elimination of all conceptual elaborations.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul thams cad dang / yon tan thams cad yongs su 'grub pa 'di ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul thams cad dang / yon tan thams cad yongs su 'grub pa 'di ni /
translated: the accomplishment of all good qualities.

original: bzang skyong / ting nge 'dzin 'di'i yongs su sbyang ba bya'o //
analyzed: bzang skyong / ting nge 'dzin 'di'i yongs su sbyang ba bya'o //
translated: Bhadrapāla, this is the thorough training in this samādhi.

original: bzang skyong / byang chub sems dpa' ni chos la sems shing chos dpyod pa yin te /
analyzed: bzang skyong / byang chub sems dpa' ni chos la sems shing chos dpyod pa yin te /
translated: “Bhadrapāla, bodhisattvas contemplate the Dharma and analyze the Dharma.

original: des ni de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi skur yang yang dag par @296a *//
analyzed: des ni de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi skur yang yang dag par @296a *//
translated: They do not see the Tathāgata as the dharmakāya,

original: rjes su mi mthong na chos kyi sku las gzhan du dmigs pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: rjes su mi mthong na chos kyi sku las gzhan du dmigs pa lta ci smos /
translated: let alone apprehend anything other than the dharmakāya.

original: bzang skyong / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' 'di ltar so sor brtag par bya ste; de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di'i don ji lta bu /
analyzed: bzang skyong / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' 'di ltar so sor brtag par bya ste; de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di'i don ji lta bu /
translated: “Bhadrapāla, here bodhisattvas should investigate thus: ‘What is the meaning of the words “tathāgata”?

original: ci gzugs de bzhin gshegs pa yin nam /
analyzed: ci gzugs de bzhin gshegs pa yin nam /
translated: Is the Tathāgata form,

original: 'on te gzugs las gzhan zhig de bzhin gshegs pa yin snyam du de ltar dpyod pa la mkhas par bya'o //
analyzed: 'on te gzugs las gzhan zhig de bzhin gshegs pa yin snyam du de ltar dpyod pa la mkhas par bya'o //
translated: or is the Tathāgata other than form?’ They should be skilled in analyzing in this way.

original: de 'di ltar so sor rtog ste /
analyzed: de 'di ltar so sor rtog ste /
translated: He should investigate in the following way:

original: gzugs kyang de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin la /
analyzed: gzugs kyang de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin la /
translated: The Tathāgata is not form,🔽nor is he apart from form.

original: gzugs las gzhan pa'ang ma yin no; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs las gzhan pa'ang ma yin no; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: gzugs ni bems po g-yo ba med pa /
analyzed: gzugs ni bems po g-yo ba med pa /
translated: Form is inanimate, unmoving,

original: dpyod pa med pa /
analyzed: dpyod pa med pa /
translated: without discrimination,

original: rtsva dang / rtsig pa dang / shing dang / bong ba dang / mig yor lta bur ngan pa /
analyzed: rtsva dang / rtsig pa dang / shing dang / bong ba dang / mig yor lta bur ngan pa /
translated: like grass, walls, tiles, or pebbles, like a magical display.

original: dbu ba rdes pa lta bu yin zhing /
analyzed: dbu ba rdes pa lta bu yin zhing /
translated: It is like a mass of foam,

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi phan tshun nas bsdus pa ni gzugs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi phan tshun nas bsdus pa ni gzugs zhes bya'o //
translated: and is called “form” because it is a composite of the four great elements.

original: gzugs ni rten cing 'brel pa las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gzugs ni rten cing 'brel pa las 'byung ngo //
translated: Form arises in dependence on conditions.

original: gang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: gang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de mi rtag pa'o //
translated: Whatever arises in dependence on conditions is impermanent.

original: gang mi rtag pa de sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: gang mi rtag pa de sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: Whatever is impermanent is suffering.

original: gang sdug bsngal ba de bdag med pa'o //🔽gang bdag med pa de rang bzhin med pa'o //🔽gang rang bzhin med pa de snang ba med pa'o //
analyzed: gang sdug bsngal ba de bdag med pa'o // gang bdag med pa de rang bzhin med pa'o // gang rang bzhin med pa de snang ba med pa'o //
translated: Whatever is suffering is not self.🔽Whatever is not self is without essence.🔽Whatever is without essence does not appear.

original: gang snang ba med pa de yang dag pa ma yin /
analyzed: gang snang ba med pa de yang dag pa ma yin /
translated: Whatever does not appear is not real.

original: gang yang dag pa ma yin pa de rdzun pa slu ba'i chos so //
analyzed: gang yang dag pa ma yin pa de rdzun pa slu ba'i chos so //
translated: That which is not real is a false, deceptive phenomenon.

original: gang rdzun pa slu pa'i chos de mi bden pa'o //
analyzed: gang rdzun pa slu pa'i chos de mi bden pa'o //
translated: That which is a false, deceptive phenomenon is not true.

original: gang mi bden pa de de bzhin @296b nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: gang mi bden pa de de bzhin @296b nyid ma yin no //
translated: That which is not true is not suchness.

original: gang de bzhin nyid ma yin pa de de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin no //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa ni bden pa /
analyzed: gang de bzhin nyid ma yin pa de de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin no // de bzhin gshegs pa ni bden pa /
translated: That which is not suchness is not the Tathāgata.🔽The Tathāgata is true,

original: yang dag pa de bzhin nyid /🔽ma nor ba de bzhin nyid /
analyzed: yang dag pa de bzhin nyid / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid /
translated: real suchness,🔽unmistaken suchness,

original: gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid /

original: mdud pa med pa'o //🔽'chi 'pho med pa'o //
analyzed: mdud pa med pa'o // 'chi 'pho med pa'o //

original: 'chi 'pho bar mi 'gyur ba'o //🔽chos ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho bar mi 'gyur ba'o // chos ma yin pa'o //

original: chos ma yin pa'ang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: chos ma yin pa'ang ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not a non-phenomenon.

original: zhing ma yin pa'o //🔽zhing ma yin pa'ang ma yin pa'o //🔽mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: zhing ma yin pa'o // zhing ma yin pa'ang ma yin pa'o // mi zad pa'o //

original: mi zad pa'ang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mi zad pa'ang ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not imperishable.

original: zad pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: zad pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: It is free of exhaustion.

original: skad cig pa'o //
analyzed: skad cig pa'o //
translated: It is momentary.

original: mi 'khrugs pa'o snyam mo //
analyzed: mi 'khrugs pa'o snyam mo //
translated: It is unshakable.

original: de 'di ltar so sor rtog ste /
analyzed: de 'di ltar so sor rtog ste /

original: 'du byed rnams de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin /

original: 'du byed rnams las gzhan pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams las gzhan pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: He is also not other than conditioned phenomena.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: gal te 'du byed rnams las gzhan pa zhig de bzhin gshegs par gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te 'du byed rnams las gzhan pa zhig de bzhin gshegs par gyur na ni /

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dngos po med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dngos po med par 'gyur ro //
translated: the Tathāgata would be a non-entity.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dngos po med pa ni 'du byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni 'du byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a non-entity is not a conditioned phenomenon.

original: de 'di ltar so sor rtog ste /
analyzed: de 'di ltar so sor rtog ste /
translated: He should investigate in the following way:

original: gal te 'du byed rnams de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin /
analyzed: gal te 'du byed rnams de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin /
translated: If the Tathāgata is not conditioned phenomena,

original: 'du byed rnams las gzhan pa'ang ma yin na /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams las gzhan pa'ang ma yin na /
translated: and also not other than conditioned phenomena,

original: ci rnam par shes pa de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: ci rnam par shes pa de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur ram /
translated: then is the Tathāgata consciousness?

original: @299b 'on te rnam par shes pa las gzhan pa zhig gam snyam mo //
analyzed: @299b 'on te rnam par shes pa las gzhan pa zhig gam snyam mo //
translated: Or is he other than consciousness?

original: de 'di ltar so sor rtog ste /
analyzed: de 'di ltar so sor rtog ste /
translated: He should investigate this matter in the following way:

original: rnam par shes pa de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin /
translated: The Tathāgata is not consciousness,

original: rnam par shes pa las gzhan pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa las gzhan pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: and also not other than consciousness.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: rnam par shes pa ni sgyu ma lta bu /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni sgyu ma lta bu /
translated: Consciousness is like an illusion,

original: gsob gsog yang dag pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: gsob gsog yang dag pa ma yin pa /
translated: hollow, insubstantial, and unreal.

original: 'du byed 'dus pa las skyes pa /
analyzed: 'du byed 'dus pa las skyes pa /

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa; 'dus pa las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa; 'dus pa las byung ba yin no //

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni gsob ma yin /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni gsob ma yin /
translated: The Tathāgata is not hollow,

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa ma yin /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa ma yin /
translated: not insubstantial,

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa 'dus pa las nges par skyes pa ma yin; rnam par shes pa ji lta ba bzhin du tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa 'dus pa las byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa 'dus pa las nges par skyes pa ma yin; rnam par shes pa ji lta ba bzhin du tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa 'dus pa las byung ba ma yin no //
translated: It does not arise from the coming together of incorrect mental activity. Consciousness does not arise from the coming together of incorrect mental activity.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa dang bral ba /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa dang bral ba /
translated: The Thus-Gone One is free from mind, mentality, and consciousness.

original: yi ge med pa /
analyzed: yi ge med pa /
translated: He is beyond letters.

original: sgra med pa /🔽yul med pa /
analyzed: sgra med pa / yul med pa /
translated: He is beyond sound.🔽He is beyond objects.

original: dngos po med pa /
analyzed: dngos po med pa /
translated: He is beyond things.

original: sems med pa /🔽ldan pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: sems med pa / ldan pa ma yin pa /
translated: He is beyond mind.🔽He is not connected.

original: mi ldan pa'ang ma yin pa /🔽blo gros med pa /
analyzed: mi ldan pa'ang ma yin pa / blo gros med pa /
translated: He is not disconnected.🔽He is beyond intellect.

original: blo gros med pa'ang ma yin pa /🔽rtogs pa med pa /
analyzed: blo gros med pa'ang ma yin pa / rtogs pa med pa /
translated: He is not beyond intellect.🔽He is beyond realization.

original: rtogs pa med pa'ang ma yin pa /🔽'gro ba med pa /
analyzed: rtogs pa med pa'ang ma yin pa / 'gro ba med pa /
translated: He is not beyond realization.🔽He is beyond going.

original: 'gro ba med pa'ang ma yin pa /🔽gnyis su med pa /
analyzed: 'gro ba med pa'ang ma yin pa / gnyis su med pa /
translated: He is not beyond going.🔽He is nondual.

original: gnyis lta bur bya ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: gnyis lta bur bya ba ma yin pa /
translated: He is not something that can be made dual.

original: mi 'da' ba /🔽mtshan nyid med pa /
analyzed: mi 'da' ba / mtshan nyid med pa /
translated: He is beyond transgression.🔽He is beyond characteristics.

original: mtshan nyid dang bral ba /
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang bral ba /
translated: He is free from characteristics.

original: mtshan nyid ma yin pa /🔽ma spros pa /
analyzed: mtshan nyid ma yin pa / ma spros pa /
translated: He is not a characteristic.

original: sgo ma yin pa /
analyzed: sgo ma yin pa /
translated: He is not a door.🔽He is not a gateway.

original: chags pa med pa /
analyzed: chags pa med pa /
translated: He is free from attachment.

original: chags pa dang bral @300a *//
analyzed: chags pa dang bral @300a *//
translated: He is free from being free.

original: ba; mthun par byed pa /
analyzed: ba; mthun par byed pa /
translated: He is in accord.

original: de bzhin nyid kyis rab tu phye ba /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyis rab tu phye ba /
translated: He is distinguished by suchness.🔽He is not that.

original: de kho na ma yin pa /🔽de kho na ma yin pa'ang ma yin pa'o snyam mo //
analyzed: de kho na ma yin pa / de kho na ma yin pa'ang ma yin pa'o snyam mo //
translated: He is not not that.

original: de 'di ltar so sor rtog ste; rnam par shes pa de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin /
analyzed: de 'di ltar so sor rtog ste; rnam par shes pa de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin /
translated: He discerns that the Tathāgata is not consciousness,

original: rnam par shes pa las gzhan pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa las gzhan pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: and he is not other than consciousness.

original: gal te rnam par shes pa las gzhan pa zhig de bzhin gshegs par gyur na ni mig yor yang de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te rnam par shes pa las gzhan pa zhig de bzhin gshegs par gyur na ni mig yor yang de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If he were the Tathāgata, then a reflection would be the Tathāgata.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?🔽Because a reflection is not consciousness.🔽He discerns that the Tathāgata is not the eyes,

original: mig yor ni rnam par shes pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig yor ni rnam par shes pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and he is not other than the eyes.🔽He discerns that the Tathāgata is not the ears,🔽the nose, the tongue, the body, or the mind,

original: de 'di ltar so sor rtog ste /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'das pa las mi dmigs /
analyzed: de 'di ltar so sor rtog ste / de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'das pa las mi dmigs /
translated: and he is not other than the mind.🔽He discerns that the Tathāgata is not the seen,🔽and he is not other than the seen.🔽He discerns that the Tathāgata is not the heard,🔽the comprehended, or the cognized,🔽and he is not other than the cognized.🔽He discerns that the Tathāgata is not the seen,🔽and he is not other than the seen.

original: ma 'ongs pa las ma yin /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa las ma yin /
translated: He discerns that the Tathāgata is not the heard,🔽the comprehended, or the cognized,🔽and he is not other than the cognized.🔽He discerns that the Tathāgata is not the seen,

original: da ltar byung ba las mi dmigs so //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba las mi dmigs so //
translated: and he is not other than the seen.🔽He discerns that the Tathāgata is not the heard,🔽the comprehended, or the cognized,

original: mi dmigs pas mi rtog go /
analyzed: mi dmigs pas mi rtog go /
translated: and he is not other than the cognized.🔽He discerns that the Tathāgata is not the seen,🔽and he is not other than the seen.🔽He discerns that the Tathāgata is not the heard,

original: rnam par mi rtog go /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog go /
translated: the comprehended, or the cognized,🔽and he is not other than the cognized.🔽He discerns that the Tathāgata is not the seen,🔽and he is not other than the seen.🔽He discerns that the Tathāgata is not the heard,🔽the comprehended, or the cognized,

original: mi rtog na so sor mi gnas so //
analyzed: mi rtog na so sor mi gnas so //
translated: and he is not other than the cognized.🔽He discerns that the Tathāgata is not the seen,🔽and he is not other than the seen.🔽He discerns that the Tathāgata is not the heard,🔽the comprehended, or the cognized,🔽and

original: so sor mi gnas na 'phro bar mi byed do //🔽mi 'phro na zhum par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: so sor mi gnas na 'phro bar mi byed do // mi 'phro na zhum par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it does not remain in a particular place, it does not move.🔽If it does not move, it does not become depressed.

original: zhum pa med na yongs su gdung ba med do //
analyzed: zhum pa med na yongs su gdung ba med do //
translated: If it is not depressed, it is not tormented.

original: yongs su gdung ba med na kun tu gdung ba med do //
analyzed: yongs su gdung ba med na kun tu gdung ba med do //
translated: If it is not tormented, it is not completely tormented.

original: kun tu gdung ba med na rjes su gdung ba med do //
analyzed: kun tu gdung ba med na rjes su gdung ba med do //
translated: If it is not completely tormented, it is not tormented in its aftermath.

original: gang rjes su gdung ba med na de mi gdung ba'o //
analyzed: gang rjes su gdung ba med na de mi gdung ba'o //
translated: If it is not tormented in its aftermath, it is not tormented.

original: gang mi gdung ba de kun tu mi rgyug go /
analyzed: gang mi gdung ba de kun tu mi rgyug go /
translated: If it is not tormented, it does not run around.

original: rnam par mi rgyug go /
analyzed: rnam par mi rgyug go /
translated: It does not run around.

original: gang mi rgyug pa de rnam par mi rgyug go /🔽rnam par mi rgyug pa de mi nyams so //🔽gang mi nyams pa de rnam par mi 'khyam mo //
analyzed: gang mi rgyug pa de rnam par mi rgyug go / rnam par mi rgyug pa de mi nyams so // gang mi nyams pa de rnam par mi 'khyam mo //
translated: If it does not run around, it does not run around in a particular way.🔽If it does not run around in a particular way, it does not deteriorate.

original: gang rnam par @300b mi 'khyam pa de 'khyam pa med do //
analyzed: gang rnam par @300b mi 'khyam pa de 'khyam pa med do //
translated: If it does not deteriorate, it does not wander around.

original: gang 'khyam pa med pa de 'khyam pa ma yin pa'o //🔽gang 'khyam pa ma yin pa de rlom sems med pa'o //
analyzed: gang 'khyam pa med pa de 'khyam pa ma yin pa'o // gang 'khyam pa ma yin pa de rlom sems med pa'o //
translated: If it does not wander around, it does not wander.🔽If it does not wander, it does not think.

original: gang rlom sems med pa de bag yod pa'o //
analyzed: gang rlom sems med pa de bag yod pa'o //
translated: If it does not think, it is heedful.

original: gang bag yod pa de 'phags pa'o //
analyzed: gang bag yod pa de 'phags pa'o //
translated: If it is heedful, it is noble.

original: gang 'phags pa de dgra bcom pa'o //
analyzed: gang 'phags pa de dgra bcom pa'o //
translated: The noble one is the arhat.

original: gang dgra bcom pa gang yin pa de la bdag gi rdul med do //
analyzed: gang dgra bcom pa gang yin pa de la bdag gi rdul med do //
translated: Whoever is an arhat is free of the dust of self.

original: sems can gyi rdul med do //
analyzed: sems can gyi rdul med do //
translated: Whoever is an arhat is free of the dust of sentient beings.🔽Whoever is an arhat is free of the dust of life.

original: srog gi rdul med do; ;gang zag gi rdul med do //
analyzed: srog gi rdul med do; ;gang zag gi rdul med do //
translated: Whoever is an arhat is free of the dust of a person.

original: phung po'i rdul med do //🔽khams kyi rdul med do //🔽skye mched kyi rdul med do //
analyzed: phung po'i rdul med do // khams kyi rdul med do // skye mched kyi rdul med do //
translated: Whoever is an arhat is free of the dust of the aggregates.🔽Whoever is an arhat is free of the dust of the elements.🔽Whoever is an arhat is free of the dust of the sense sources.

original: dngos po'i rdul med do //🔽rgyu'i rdul med do //🔽rkyen gyi rdul med do; ;dmigs pa'i rdul med do //
analyzed: dngos po'i rdul med do // rgyu'i rdul med do // rkyen gyi rdul med do; ;dmigs pa'i rdul med do //
translated: Whoever is an arhat is free of the dust of entities.🔽Whoever is an arhat is free of the dust of causes.🔽Whoever is an arhat is free of the dust of conditions.

original: kun 'byung ba'i rdul med do //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba'i rdul med do //
translated: Whoever is an arhat is free of the dust of objects.🔽Whoever is an arhat is free of the dust of origination.

original: nga rgyal gyis lhag par byed pa'i rdul med do //
analyzed: nga rgyal gyis lhag par byed pa'i rdul med do //
translated: Whoever is an arhat is free of the dust of pride.

original: tshor ba'i rdul med do //🔽'dod chags kyi rdul med do //
analyzed: tshor ba'i rdul med do // 'dod chags kyi rdul med do //
translated: Whoever is an arhat is free of the dust of feeling.🔽Whoever is an arhat is free of the dust of desire.

original: zhe sdang gi rdul med do //
analyzed: zhe sdang gi rdul med do //
translated: Whoever is an arhat is free of the dust of anger.

original: gti mug gi rdul med do //🔽khro ba'i rdul med do //
analyzed: gti mug gi rdul med do // khro ba'i rdul med do //
translated: Whoever is an arhat is free of the dust of delusion.🔽Whoever is an arhat is free of the dust of wrath.

original: 'khon du 'dzin pa'i rdul med do //
analyzed: 'khon du 'dzin pa'i rdul med do //
translated: Whoever is an arhat is free of the dust of resentment.

original: nga rgyal gyi rdul med do //
analyzed: nga rgyal gyi rdul med do //
translated: Whoever is an arhat is free of the dust of pride.

original: nga rgyal dang / 'chab pa dang / yongs su gdung ba'i rdul med do //
analyzed: nga rgyal dang / 'chab pa dang / yongs su gdung ba'i rdul med do //
translated: Whoever is an arhat is free of the dust of conceit, hypocrisy, and distress.

original: nga rgyal dang lhag pa'i nga rgyal gyi rdul med do //🔽sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dvags kyi rdul med do //
analyzed: nga rgyal dang lhag pa'i nga rgyal gyi rdul med do // sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dvags kyi rdul med do //
translated: They are free of the dust of pride and the dust of the conceit of thinking “I am.”🔽They are free of the dust of the hells, the dust of animals, and the dust of the world of the lord of death.

original: gshin rje'i 'jig rten gyi rdul med do; ;'dod pa'i khams kyi rdul med do //🔽gzugs kyi khams kyi rdul med do //
analyzed: gshin rje'i 'jig rten gyi rdul med do; ;'dod pa'i khams kyi rdul med do // gzugs kyi khams kyi rdul med do //
translated: They are free of the dust of the desire realm,🔽the dust of the form realm,

original: gzugs med pa'i khams kyi rdul med do //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams kyi rdul med do //
translated: and the dust of the formless realm.

original: 'khor ba'i rdul med do //🔽rnam pa de lta @301a *//
analyzed: 'khor ba'i rdul med do // rnam pa de lta @301a *//
translated: They are free of the dust of saṃsāra.

original: bur rdul mi dmigs te /🔽gang 'dod chags dang bral zhing rdul med pa de dag 'phags pa zhes bya /
analyzed: bur rdul mi dmigs te / gang 'dod chags dang bral zhing rdul med pa de dag 'phags pa zhes bya /
translated: In this way, dust is not observed.🔽Those who are free from desire and dust are called noble ones.

original: dgra bcom pa zhes bya /🔽grol ba zhes bya /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa zhes bya / grol ba zhes bya /
translated: They are called worthy ones.🔽They are called liberated.

original: rnam par grol ba zhes bya /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba zhes bya /
translated: They are called fully liberated.

original: lha'i dam pa zhes bya /
analyzed: lha'i dam pa zhes bya /
translated: They are called the highest of gods.

original: rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa zhes bya /
analyzed: rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa zhes bya /
translated: They are called always in meditative equipoise.

original: sangs rgyas zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes bya ste /
translated: They are called buddhas.

original: de chos gang la'ang rlom sems med do //
analyzed: de chos gang la'ang rlom sems med do //
translated: They have no conceit about any phenomenon.

original: rlom sems med pa kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rlom sems med pa kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who have no conceit are not defiled.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa med na kun tu gdung ba med do //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa med na kun tu gdung ba med do //
translated: If there is no affliction, there is no torment.

original: kun tu gdung ba med na rang bzhin thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kun tu gdung ba med na rang bzhin thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: If there is no torment, there is the attainment of the natural state.

original: rang bzhin thob na chos gang la'ang mi spyod do //
analyzed: rang bzhin thob na chos gang la'ang mi spyod do //
translated: If there is the attainment of the natural state, there is no engagement with any phenomenon.

original: mi spyod na 'di ltar /
analyzed: mi spyod na 'di ltar /
translated: If there is no engagement, then:

original: ci gzugs byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'am /
analyzed: ci gzugs byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'am /
translated: Is form fully awakened into buddhahood?

original: 'on te tshor ba dang / 'du shes pa dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'am /
analyzed: 'on te tshor ba dang / 'du shes pa dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'am /
translated: Or is feeling, perception, formation, or consciousness fully awakened into buddhahood?

original: su zhig byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya /
analyzed: su zhig byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya /
translated: Who is fully awakened into buddhahood?

original: ci phung po lnga chos ston tam /
analyzed: ci phung po lnga chos ston tam /
translated: Do the five aggregates teach the Dharma?

original: phung po lnga ni yang dag pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: phung po lnga ni yang dag pa ma yin pa /
translated: The five aggregates are not real.

original: sgyu ma lta bu /🔽gsob / gsog /
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu / gsob / gsog /
translated: They are like an illusion.🔽They are hollow and false.

original: dngos po med pa /
analyzed: dngos po med pa /
translated: They are unreal.

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa 'dus ba las byung ba'o //
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa 'dus ba las byung ba'o //
translated: They arise from the convergence of unreal mental activity.

original: chos kyi dbyings ni gsob ma yin /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ni gsob ma yin /
translated: The realm of phenomena is not hollow.

original: gsog ma yin; yang dag pa ma yin pa ma yin /
analyzed: gsog ma yin; yang dag pa ma yin pa ma yin /
translated: It is not false. It is not unreal.

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa las byung ba ma yin /🔽sgyu ma lta bu ma yin /
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa las byung ba ma yin / sgyu ma lta bu ma yin /
translated: It does not arise from improper mental activity.🔽It is not like an illusion.

original: smig rgyu lta bu ma yin /
analyzed: smig rgyu lta bu ma yin /
translated: It is not like a mirage.

original: chu zla lta bu ma yin /

translated: Perception is like a mirage.

original: mig dang / gzugs dang / snang ba dang / yid la byed pa 'dus pa las byung ba ste; des kyang dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bsags /
analyzed: mig dang / gzugs dang / snang ba dang / yid la byed pa 'dus pa las byung ba ste; des kyang dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bsags /
translated: It arises from the combination of the eye, form, light, and mental activity, and it does not accumulate roots of virtue.

original: 'du byed ni dngos po med pa /
analyzed: 'du byed ni dngos po med pa /
translated: “Formations are unreal,

original: rdzun pa slu ba'i chos can /
analyzed: rdzun pa slu ba'i chos can /
translated: false, and deceptive.

original: ma rig pa 'dus pa las byung ba ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa 'dus pa las byung ba ste /
translated: They arise from the combination of ignorance,

original: de dag gis kyang dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bsags /
analyzed: de dag gis kyang dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bsags /
translated: and they do not accumulate roots of virtue.

original: @304a *// rnam par shes pa ni sgyu ma lta bu /
analyzed: @304a *// rnam par shes pa ni sgyu ma lta bu /
translated: “Consciousness is like an illusion,

original: gsob / gsog /
analyzed: gsob / gsog /
translated: hollow, and void.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa /
translated: It is not real,

original: 'du byed 'dus pa las nges par skyes pa /
analyzed: 'du byed 'dus pa las nges par skyes pa /
translated: and it definitely arises from the combination of formations.

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa 'dus pa las byung ba ste /🔽des kyang dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bsags so snyam nas des de ltar brtags pa dang / gang gis dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa de mi dmigs so; ;des de ltar brtags na mi dmigs te /
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa 'dus pa las byung ba ste / des kyang dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bsags so snyam nas des de ltar brtags pa dang / gang gis dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa de mi dmigs so; ;des de ltar brtags na mi dmigs te /
translated: It arises from the combination of improper mental activity,🔽and it does not accumulate roots of virtue.”🔽When he examines in this way, he does not observe the accumulation of roots of virtue.

original: mi dmigs so snyam pa'i rlom sems kyang med do //
analyzed: mi dmigs so snyam pa'i rlom sems kyang med do //
translated: When he examines in this way, he does not observe, and he does not have the conceit of nonobservation.

original: gang byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug pa de'ang mi dmigs te /
analyzed: gang byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug pa de'ang mi dmigs te /
translated: They do not apprehend the seat of awakening,

original: mi dmigs so snyam pa'i rlom sems kyang med do //
analyzed: mi dmigs so snyam pa'i rlom sems kyang med do //
translated: and they do not think, ‘I do not apprehend it.’

original: des byang chub kyang mi dmigs te /
analyzed: des byang chub kyang mi dmigs te /
translated: They do not apprehend awakening,

original: mi dmigs so snyam pa'i rlom sems kyang med do //
analyzed: mi dmigs so snyam pa'i rlom sems kyang med do //
translated: and they do not think, ‘I do not apprehend it.’

original: 'di la su zhig mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba de'ang mi dmigs te /
analyzed: 'di la su zhig mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba de'ang mi dmigs te /
translated: They do not apprehend anyone who attains perfect buddhahood,

original: mi dmigs so snyam pa'i rlom sems kyang med do //
analyzed: mi dmigs so snyam pa'i rlom sems kyang med do //
translated: and they do not think, ‘I do not apprehend it.’

original: des de ltar so sor brtags nas byang chub kyi rlom sems kyang med /
analyzed: des de ltar so sor brtags nas byang chub kyi rlom sems kyang med /
translated: “Bhadrapāla, when they investigate in this way, they have no conceit about awakening,

original: sems can gyi rlom sems kyang med /
analyzed: sems can gyi rlom sems kyang med /
translated: no conceit about sentient beings,

original: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyi rlom sems kyang med pa de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyi rlom sems kyang med pa de /
translated: and no conceit about the wisdom of the buddhas.

original: bzang skyong / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ste /
analyzed: bzang skyong / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ste /
translated: Bhadrapāla, this is unsurpassed and perfect awakening.

original: de chos gang la'ang rlom sems med do; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽de chos gang yang skye ba'ang mi mthong /
analyzed: de chos gang la'ang rlom sems med do; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na / de chos gang yang skye ba'ang mi mthong /
translated: They have no conceit about any phenomenon. And why?🔽They do not see any phenomenon arising

original: 'gag pa'ang mi mthong ste /
analyzed: 'gag pa'ang mi mthong ste /
translated: or ceasing.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du zhi ba'i gnas khong du chud pas de'i phyir sangs @304b rgyas zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du zhi ba'i gnas khong du chud pas de'i phyir sangs @304b rgyas zhes bya ste /
translated: Because they have realized the state of peace just as it is, they are called buddhas.

original: de ni rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / kun tu rtog pa thams cad la mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: de ni rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / kun tu rtog pa thams cad la mi 'jug ste /
translated: They do not engage with any thoughts, concepts, or ideas.

original: de ni zhi ba'o //
analyzed: de ni zhi ba'o //
translated: That is peace.

original: bsil bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: bsil bar gyur pa'o //
translated: That is coolness.

original: sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa dang bral ba ni sangs rgyas zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa dang bral ba ni sangs rgyas zhes bya ste /
translated: Being free from mind, mentality, and consciousness is called buddha.

original: bzang skyong / 'di ni rab tu zhi ba rnam par nges pa'i cho 'phrul zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: bzang skyong / 'di ni rab tu zhi ba rnam par nges pa'i cho 'phrul zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: Bhadrapāla, this is the absorption that is the magical display of the ascertainment of peace.

original: bzang skyong / ting nge 'dzin 'di la slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyis mngon par 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: bzang skyong / ting nge 'dzin 'di la slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyis mngon par 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Bhadrapāla, bodhisattvas who train in this absorption will master all the other absorptions.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas 'di skad ces gsol to; ;bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas 'di skad ces gsol to; ;bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Then Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta said to the Blessed One, “Blessed One,

original: gang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ma skyes /
analyzed: gang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ma skyes /
translated: the blessed buddhas are unborn.

original: ma 'gags kyang skye zhing 'gag par kun tu gda' ba dang / yi ge gcig kyang mi brjod la /
analyzed: ma 'gags kyang skye zhing 'gag par kun tu gda' ba dang / yi ge gcig kyang mi brjod la /
translated: Even though they are unceasing, they are seen to arise and cease.🔽Even though they do not utter a single syllable, they are seen to teach the Dharma to countless millions of retinues.

original: 'khor bye ba grangs ma mchis pa la chos ston par yang kun tu gda' ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi thabs la mkhas pa ni ngo mtshar to //
analyzed: 'khor bye ba grangs ma mchis pa la chos ston par yang kun tu gda' ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi thabs la mkhas pa ni ngo mtshar to //
translated: The skillful means of the blessed buddhas is truly amazing!”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Then the Blessed One said to Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta,

original: 'jam dpal / gang yon tan gyi snying po bcu gnyis kyis mngon par 'phags pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas la bskal pa snyigs ma'ang kun tu ston pa dang /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / gang yon tan gyi snying po bcu gnyis kyis mngon par 'phags pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas la bskal pa snyigs ma'ang kun tu ston pa dang /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, those who fully awaken to unsurpassed and perfect buddhahood in a buddha realm that is exalted by the twelve essential qualities of virtue demonstrate an eon of degeneration,

original: dus snyigs ma dang / sems can snyigs ma dang / nyon @305a *//
analyzed: dus snyigs ma dang / sems can snyigs ma dang / nyon @305a *//
translated: an age of degeneration, sentient beings of degeneration, and afflictions of degeneration.

original: mongs pa snyigs ma dang / tshe snyigs ma dang / theg pa tha dad pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing nye bar ston pa dang / chos ston pa sna tshogs dang / sems can yongs su smin par byed pa sna tshogs dang /
analyzed: mongs pa snyigs ma dang / tshe snyigs ma dang / theg pa tha dad pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing nye bar ston pa dang / chos ston pa sna tshogs dang / sems can yongs su smin par byed pa sna tshogs dang /
translated: the defilement of the dregs, the dregs of life, the different vehicles, the display of defiled buddha-fields, the various teachings of the Dharma, the various maturations of beings,

original: gzhan mu stegs can gyis dkrugs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / bdud dang bdud kyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / bdud kyi las dang / pha rol gyi dmag tshogs kyis gtso ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / yul 'khrug pa dang / khrag khrug dang /
analyzed: gzhan mu stegs can gyis dkrugs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / bdud dang bdud kyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / bdud kyi las dang / pha rol gyi dmag tshogs kyis gtso ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / yul 'khrug pa dang / khrag khrug dang /
translated: the defilement of the agitation of other sectarians, the defilement of Mara, the defilement of the works of Mara, the defilement of the invasion of foreign armies, the defilement of internal revolts and tumults,

original: chom po'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / kla klos dkrugs pa dang / rkun pos dkrugs pa dang / mu ges dkrugs pa dang / gnod sbyin dang / srin po dang / yi dvags dang / sha za dang / grul bum dang / lus srul po'i 'khrug pa'ang kun tu ston cing sangs rgyas kyi zhing de na nyes pa de dag kyang med la /
analyzed: chom po'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / kla klos dkrugs pa dang / rkun pos dkrugs pa dang / mu ges dkrugs pa dang / gnod sbyin dang / srin po dang / yi dvags dang / sha za dang / grul bum dang / lus srul po'i 'khrug pa'ang kun tu ston cing sangs rgyas kyi zhing de na nyes pa de dag kyang med la /
translated: But in that buddhafield, those faults do not exist.🔽By the power of the blessing of the Tathāgata’s previous roots of virtue, conduct, prayers, and skill in means, he ripens beings in accordance with their training.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / spyod pa dang / smon lam dang / thabs la mkhas pa'i stobs kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis 'dul ba ji lta ba bzhin du sems can yongs su smin par byed pas sems can rnams kyi bya ba de dag shes kyang de bzhin gshegs pa ni thams cad du btang snyoms pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / spyod pa dang / smon lam dang / thabs la mkhas pa'i stobs kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis 'dul ba ji lta ba bzhin du sems can yongs su smin par byed pas sems can rnams kyi bya ba de dag shes kyang de bzhin gshegs pa ni thams cad du btang snyoms pa ste /
translated: Although he knows those activities of beings, the Tathāgata is impartial toward all.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa 'di'ang de bzhin gshegs pa'i thabs mkhas par blta'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa 'di'ang de bzhin gshegs pa'i thabs mkhas par blta'o //
translated: This nonconceptuality should be seen as the skill in means of the Tathāgata.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan @305b 'das la 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan @305b 'das la 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Blessed One having said this, Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta said to him,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de yon tan gyi snying po gang dag dang ldan pa dang / yon tan gang dang ldan na sangs rgyas kyi zhing der sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i yon tan gyi snying po bcu gnyis po de bcom ldan 'das kyis bshad du gsol /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de yon tan gyi snying po gang dag dang ldan pa dang / yon tan gang dang ldan na sangs rgyas kyi zhing der sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i yon tan gyi snying po bcu gnyis po de bcom ldan 'das kyis bshad du gsol /
translated: “Blessed One, please explain the twelve essential qualities of the buddhafield in which the blessed buddhas fully awaken, and the qualities that it possesses.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: 'jam dpal / sangs rgyas kyi zhing de ni bskal pa'i snying po dang ldan pa yin /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / sangs rgyas kyi zhing de ni bskal pa'i snying po dang ldan pa yin /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, that buddhafield has the essence of eons,

original: dus kyi snying po dang ldan pa yin /
analyzed: dus kyi snying po dang ldan pa yin /
translated: the essence of time,

original: sems can gyi snying po dang ldan pa yin; zhing gi snying po dang ldan pa yin /
analyzed: sems can gyi snying po dang ldan pa yin; zhing gi snying po dang ldan pa yin /
translated: the essence of beings, the essence of fields,

original: theg pa'i snying po dang ldan pa yin /
analyzed: theg pa'i snying po dang ldan pa yin /
translated: the essence of vehicles,

original: sa'i snying po dang ldan pa yin /
analyzed: sa'i snying po dang ldan pa yin /
translated: the essence of earth,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de bstan pa'i snying po dang ldan pa yin /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de bstan pa'i snying po dang ldan pa yin /
translated: That buddha realm will have the essence of the teaching.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing der gzhan mu stegs can spyod pa pa dang / kun tu rgyu dang / gcer pu pa rnams mi rgyu ba yin /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing der gzhan mu stegs can spyod pa pa dang / kun tu rgyu dang / gcer pu pa rnams mi rgyu ba yin /
translated: In that buddha realm, non-Buddhists, such as carakas, parivrājakas, and nirgranthas, will not appear.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de bsam pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pa yin /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de bsam pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pa yin /
translated: That buddha realm will be filled with those who have the intention and the superior intention.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de ni rang bzhin gyis dkar po'i chos dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams gnas pa yin /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de ni rang bzhin gyis dkar po'i chos dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams gnas pa yin /
translated: That buddha realm will be the abode of beings who naturally possess the qualities of virtue.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de 'phags pa'i skye po'i snying po dang ldan pa yin /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de 'phags pa'i skye po'i snying po dang ldan pa yin /
translated: That buddha realm will have the essence of the noble ones.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing der sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams gshegs shing rjes su gshegs pa yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing der sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams gshegs shing rjes su gshegs pa yin te /
translated: In that buddha realm, the previous thus-gone ones have gone and will go again.

original: 'jam dpal / sangs rgyas kyi zhing de ni yon tan gyi snying po bcu gnyis po de dag @306a *//🔽dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / sangs rgyas kyi zhing de ni yon tan gyi snying po bcu gnyis po de dag @306a *//🔽dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Mañjuśrī, that buddha realm will have these twelve essences of qualities.

original: der sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: der sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: It is there that the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, attain the supreme, perfect enlightenment.

original: 'jam dpal / khyod kyis rnam grangs 'dis kyang nga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing na nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa tha dad pa rnam par gzhag pa med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / khyod kyis rnam grangs 'dis kyang nga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing na nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa tha dad pa rnam par gzhag pa med par rig par bya'o //
translated: Mañjuśrī, you should understand this teaching to mean that in my buddhafield there are no such distinctions as the vehicles of the hearers and solitary buddhas.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na; tha dad pa'i 'du shes dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na; tha dad pa'i 'du shes dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Why is this? Because there is no conception of distinctions.

original: 'jam dpal / gal te de bzhin gshegs pa sems can kha cig la ni theg pa chen po ston /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / gal te de bzhin gshegs pa sems can kha cig la ni theg pa chen po ston /
translated: Mañjuśrī, if the Thus-Gone One were to teach the Great Vehicle to some beings,

original: kha cig la ni rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang / sems can kha cig la ni nyan thos kyi theg pa ston tam /
analyzed: kha cig la ni rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang / sems can kha cig la ni nyan thos kyi theg pa ston tam /
translated: the vehicle of the solitary buddhas to others, and the vehicle of the hearers to still others,

original: de ltar gyur na de bzhin gshegs pa sems yongs su ma dag par 'gyur /
analyzed: de ltar gyur na de bzhin gshegs pa sems yongs su ma dag par 'gyur /
translated: then the Thus-Gone One’s mind would not be pure.

original: sems mi snyoms par 'gyur; mngon par chags par 'gyur /
analyzed: sems mi snyoms par 'gyur; mngon par chags par 'gyur /
translated: His mind would be uneven, and he would be attached.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa nyi tshe ba'i snying rje dang ldan par 'gyur /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa nyi tshe ba'i snying rje dang ldan par 'gyur /
translated: the Thus-Gone One would possess limited compassion;

original: de bzhin gshegs pa sna tshogs kyi 'du shes kyi skyon du ltung par 'gyur; de bzhin gshegs pa slob dpon chos kyi dpe mkhyud byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa sna tshogs kyi 'du shes kyi skyon du ltung par 'gyur; de bzhin gshegs pa slob dpon chos kyi dpe mkhyud byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: the Thus-Gone One would fall into the fault of having a variety of perceptions; and the Thus-Gone One would be a teacher who withholds the Dharma.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pa chos gang ci ston kyang rung /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pa chos gang ci ston kyang rung /
translated: Mañjuśrī, whatever Dharma the Thus-Gone One teaches,

original: chos de dag thams cad kyang theg pa chen po la gzhol ba /🔽theg pa chen po la 'bab pa /
analyzed: chos de dag thams cad kyang theg pa chen po la gzhol ba / theg pa chen po la 'bab pa /
translated: all those Dharmas are directed toward the Great Vehicle,🔽they are focused on the Great Vehicle,

original: theg pa chen po la bab pa /
analyzed: theg pa chen po la bab pa /
translated: they are oriented toward the Great Vehicle,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes sgrub pa /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes sgrub pa /
translated: they accomplish the wisdom of omniscience,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par @306b byed pa; thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par bya ba'i phyir 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par @306b byed pa; thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par bya ba'i phyir 'jug pa ste /
translated: they cause the attainment of the wisdom of omniscience, and they lead to the attainment of the wisdom of omniscience.

original: 'jam dpal / de'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi zhing de na theg pa tha dad pa rnam par gzhag pa med do //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi zhing de na theg pa tha dad pa rnam par gzhag pa med do //
translated: Mañjuśrī, therefore, in that buddha realm there is no establishment of different vehicles.

original: 'jam dpal gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis gsol pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī said:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: gal te theg pa tha dad pa rnam par gzhag pa ma mchis na /
analyzed: gal te theg pa tha dad pa rnam par gzhag pa ma mchis na /
translated: If there are no different vehicles to be posited,🔽then why did the Lord teach three vehicles to sentient beings,

original: 'di ni nyan thos kyi theg pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni nyan thos kyi theg pa'o //
translated: saying, ‘This is the Śrāvaka Vehicle,

original: 'di ni rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'o //
translated: this is the Pratyekabuddha Vehicle,

original: 'di ni theg pa chen po'o zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis sems can rnams la theg pa gsum bstan pa de ji lta bu lags /
analyzed: 'di ni theg pa chen po'o zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis sems can rnams la theg pa gsum bstan pa de ji lta bu lags /
translated: and this is the Great Vehicle’?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord replied, “Mañjuśrī,

original: 'jam dpal / theg pa tha dad pa zhes bya ba de ni sa rnam par gzhag pa'i tshig bla dvags so //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / theg pa tha dad pa zhes bya ba de ni sa rnam par gzhag pa'i tshig bla dvags so //
translated: the so-called different vehicles are a designation for the levels.

original: 'jam dpal / rab 'bring tha ma'i chos bstan pa zhes bya ba de ni de bzhin gshegs pas chos kyi mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag par bstan to //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / rab 'bring tha ma'i chos bstan pa zhes bya ba de ni de bzhin gshegs pas chos kyi mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag par bstan to //
translated: Mañjuśrī, the so-called teaching of the Dharma for those of highest, middling, and least abilities is a teaching by the Tathāgata of the characteristics of the Dharma.

original: de ni de bzhin gshegs pas gang zag rnam par gzhag par bzhag go /
analyzed: de ni de bzhin gshegs pas gang zag rnam par gzhag par bzhag go /
translated: That is how the Tathāgata posits the person.”

original: tshogs chung du bsags pa'i sems can rnams dang / bsod nams kyi tshogs tshad med pa bsags pa'i sems can rnams yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir theg pa tha dad par bzhag gi /
analyzed: tshogs chung du bsags pa'i sems can rnams dang / bsod nams kyi tshogs tshad med pa bsags pa'i sems can rnams yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir theg pa tha dad par bzhag gi /
translated: For the sake of bringing to maturity those sentient beings who have accumulated a small amount of merit and those who have accumulated immeasurable merit, the vehicles are presented as being separate.

original: theg pa ni tha dad du dbyer med do //
analyzed: theg pa ni tha dad du dbyer med do //
translated: However, the vehicles are not differentiated.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos kyi dbyings dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the realm of phenomena is undifferentiated.

original: 'jam dpal / theg pa bstan pa zhes bya ba de ni de bzhin gshegs pas sgrib pa med par gsungs so //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / theg pa bstan pa zhes bya ba de ni de bzhin gshegs pas sgrib pa med par gsungs so //
translated: Mañjuśrī, the so-called teaching of the vehicles was taught by the Tathāgata as being unobstructed.

original: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: dper @307a *// na; 'phong gi slob dpon mkhas pa 'phong shes pa'i mchog gi pha rol tu phyin pa /
analyzed: dper @307a *// na; 'phong gi slob dpon mkhas pa 'phong shes pa'i mchog gi pha rol tu phyin pa /
translated: For example, a skilled master of archery, who is the best at archery and has perfected it,

original: thabs dang / spyod lam rnam pa sna tshogs dang / 'bad pa dang / spyod lam sna tshogs ston cing slob ma la 'phong slob kyang 'phong shes pa de gcig yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: thabs dang / spyod lam rnam pa sna tshogs dang / 'bad pa dang / spyod lam sna tshogs ston cing slob ma la 'phong slob kyang 'phong shes pa de gcig yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: teaches archery to his students by demonstrating various methods, conduct, effort, and postures, even though he is the only one who knows how to shoot.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi 'phong gi slob dpon mkhas pa'ang chos kyi tshul sna tshogs la 'jug pas khams dang / bsam pa dang / mos pa tha dad par sems can rnams la bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub gcig las theg pa gsum du ston to //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi 'phong gi slob dpon mkhas pa'ang chos kyi tshul sna tshogs la 'jug pas khams dang / bsam pa dang / mos pa tha dad par sems can rnams la bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub gcig las theg pa gsum du ston to //
translated: Mañjuśrī, the Tathāgata, the skilled master of the Dharma, teaches the one unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening of sentient beings as three vehicles, by means of engaging in the various ways of the Dharma, in accordance with their different elements, aspirations, and interests.

original: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: dper na / me stag chung ngu yar ba'ang rtsva'i rgyu dang ldan zhing mched na sreg pa'i bskal pa'i me lta bur tshig par nus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na / me stag chung ngu yar ba'ang rtsva'i rgyu dang ldan zhing mched na sreg pa'i bskal pa'i me lta bur tshig par nus par 'gyur ro //
translated: for example, a small spark, when it spreads, is able to burn like the fire at the end of the eon, because it has the cause of grass.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du phyir mi ldog pa'i ye shes kyi snang ba'i ma stag gcig po de'ang nyon mongs pa thams cad sreg pa'i phyir mthar gyis mched cing de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes chen po'i snang ba'i bar du byed nus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du phyir mi ldog pa'i ye shes kyi snang ba'i ma stag gcig po de'ang nyon mongs pa thams cad sreg pa'i phyir mthar gyis mched cing de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes chen po'i snang ba'i bar du byed nus par 'gyur ro //
translated: Mañjuśrī, in the same way, that one spark of the light of the wisdom of irreversibility, in order to burn up all afflictions, gradually spreads and is able to become the light of the great wisdom of the Tathāgata.

original: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: dper na / ri dvags phra mo thams cad ri dvags kyi rgyal po seng ge ral pa can gyi mdun na 'dug par nus pa med do //🔽'jam dpal / de bzhin du gzhan mu stegs can spyod pa pa dang / kun tu rgyu dang / gcer pu pa dang / @307b 'tsho ba can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdun na 'dug par ram /
analyzed: dper na / ri dvags phra mo thams cad ri dvags kyi rgyal po seng ge ral pa can gyi mdun na 'dug par nus pa med do // 'jam dpal / de bzhin du gzhan mu stegs can spyod pa pa dang / kun tu rgyu dang / gcer pu pa dang / @307b 'tsho ba can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdun na 'dug par ram /
translated: For example, all small animals are unable to stand before the lion, the king of beasts, with his mane.

original: tshig smra bar nus pa med de /
analyzed: tshig smra bar nus pa med de /
translated: Mañjuśrī, in the same way, all non-Buddhists, such as the carakas, the parivrājakas, the dīkṣitas, and the ājīvikas, are unable to stand before the Tathāgata or speak a word.

original: stobs bcu'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhis 'jigs pa med pa'i skyes bu chen po'i seng ge'i mdun na sgra sgrog par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i gnas med de /
analyzed: stobs bcu'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhis 'jigs pa med pa'i skyes bu chen po'i seng ge'i mdun na sgra sgrog par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i gnas med de /
translated: There is no way that they could utter a sound before the lion, the great being, who is fearless through the ten powers and the four forms of fearlessness.

original: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pas byin gyis brlabs pa ni ma gtogs so //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pas byin gyis brlabs pa ni ma gtogs so //
translated: This is except for those who are blessed by the Tathāgata in order to ripen sentient beings.

original: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: dper na / nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor shar pa 'od zer gyi dra ba brgya stong grangs med pa rab tu 'gyed pas /
analyzed: dper na / nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor shar pa 'od zer gyi dra ba brgya stong grangs med pa rab tu 'gyed pas /
translated: When the orb of the sun rises, it radiates countless hundreds of thousands of nets of light rays.

original: srin bu me khyer thams cad 'od med cing /
analyzed: srin bu me khyer thams cad 'od med cing /
translated: All fireflies are without light,🔽not radiant,

original: lam me ma yin /🔽lhang nge ma yin te /
analyzed: lam me ma yin / lhang nge ma yin te /
translated: not clear,

original: mdzes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mdzes pa ma yin no //
translated: and not beautiful.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i bla na med pa'i ye shes chen po'i nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor shar nas /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i bla na med pa'i ye shes chen po'i nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor shar nas /
translated: Mañjuśrī, in the same way, when the sun-disk of the Tathāgata’s unsurpassed great wisdom has risen,

original: ye shes chen po'i 'od zer brgya stong grangs med pa rab tu bkye bas /
analyzed: ye shes chen po'i 'od zer brgya stong grangs med pa rab tu bkye bas /
translated: emitting countless hundreds of thousands of light rays of great wisdom,

original: gzhan mu stegs can spyod pa pa dang / kun tu rgyu dang / gcer bu pa la sogs pa thams cad 'od med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan mu stegs can spyod pa pa dang / kun tu rgyu dang / gcer bu pa la sogs pa thams cad 'od med par 'gyur te /
translated: all the non-Buddhists—the Carakas, the Parivrājakas, the Nirgranthas, and so on—become without light,

original: lam me ma yin /
analyzed: lam me ma yin /
translated: not radiant,

original: lhang nge ma yin zhing /
analyzed: lhang nge ma yin zhing /
translated: not clear,

original: mdzes pa ma yin pa 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi brlabs su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: mdzes pa ma yin pa 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi brlabs su shes par bya'o //
translated: and not beautiful. This should be known as the Tathāgata’s blessing.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i thabs mkhas pa'i yul de ni bsam gyis mi khyab ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i thabs mkhas pa'i yul de ni bsam gyis mi khyab ste /
translated: The domain of the Tathāgata’s skillful means is inconceivable.

original: des na sangs rgyas kyi zhing der gzhan mu stegs can spyod pa pa dang / kun tu rgyu dang / gcer bu pa @308a *//
analyzed: des na sangs rgyas kyi zhing der gzhan mu stegs can spyod pa pa dang / kun tu rgyu dang / gcer bu pa @308a *//
translated: Therefore, in that buddha-field, the non-Buddhists—the Carakas, the Parivrājakas, the Nirgranthas, and so on—

original: rnams kun tu snang ngo //
analyzed: rnams kun tu snang ngo //
translated: They all appear.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzhan mu stegs can gyi sgo de dag thams cad ni rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin bsam gyis mi khyab pa la gnas pa /
analyzed: gzhan mu stegs can gyi sgo de dag thams cad ni rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin bsam gyis mi khyab pa la gnas pa /
translated: All those non-Buddhist gateways are based on the inconceivable liberation and samādhi,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las nges par byung ba /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las nges par byung ba /
translated: they have emerged from the perfection of wisdom,

original: thabs mkhas pa chen pos rnam par rtsen pa /
analyzed: thabs mkhas pa chen pos rnam par rtsen pa /
translated: they are the play of great skillful means,

original: sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun yid la byed pa dang ma bral ba /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun yid la byed pa dang ma bral ba /
translated: they are never separate from the recollection of the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṅgha,

original: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i mchog gi pha rol tu son pa ste /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i mchog gi pha rol tu son pa ste /
translated: and they have reached the other shore of supreme ripening of sentient beings.

original: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis byin gyis brlabs pa dag go /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis byin gyis brlabs pa dag go /
translated: They are blessed by the blessing of the Tathāgata in order to ripen sentient beings.

original: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: dper na / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rdul phra rab kyi rdul snyed kyi sems can de dag sems can re re nas /
analyzed: dper na / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rdul phra rab kyi rdul snyed kyi sems can de dag sems can re re nas /
translated: If there were sentient beings as numerous as the atoms in a great trichiliocosm, and if each sentient being

original: dzambu'i gling la dbang ba'i rgyal por gyur te /
analyzed: dzambu'i gling la dbang ba'i rgyal por gyur te /
translated: He will become a king who rules over the Rose Apple Continent.

original: de dag thams cad kyis tshig 'di skad ces bdag cag gis theg pa chen po gang len pa dang / 'dzin pa dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par byed pa de sha las nyi ma re re zhing yang srang lnga lnga sen mos gcad par bya ste /
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyis tshig 'di skad ces bdag cag gis theg pa chen po gang len pa dang / 'dzin pa dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par byed pa de sha las nyi ma re re zhing yang srang lnga lnga sen mos gcad par bya ste /
translated: All of them will say, ‘We will take up, hold, read, and master the Great Vehicle. Every day we will cut off five ounces of flesh from our bodies.

original: de tshul de lta bus srog dang dbral lo zhes smra ba la /
analyzed: de tshul de lta bus srog dang dbral lo zhes smra ba la /
translated: We will take our lives in this way.’

original: 'jam dpal / gal te byang chub sems dpa' de skad smra bas mi skrag /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / gal te byang chub sems dpa' de skad smra bas mi skrag /
translated: Mañjuśrī, if that bodhisattva is not frightened by such words,

original: mi dngang / dngang bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi dngang / dngang bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: is not terrified,

original: tha na skrag pa'i sems kyang mi skyed /🔽zhum pa med /
analyzed: tha na skrag pa'i sems kyang mi skyed / zhum pa med /
translated: and does not even develop a frightened mind,🔽is not discouraged,

original: gong ba @308b med; the tshom med la /
analyzed: gong ba @308b med; the tshom med la /
translated: is not doubtful,

original: phyir zhing chos yongs su gzung ba la brtson te /
analyzed: phyir zhing chos yongs su gzung ba la brtson te /

analyzed: klog pa dang / kha ton byed pa la brtson par 'gyur ba'i byang chub sems dpa' de ni /
translated: and is diligent in reading and reciting it,

original: 'jam dpal / sems dpa' ba /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / sems dpa' ba /
translated: Mañjuśrī, that bodhisattva🔽is a hero,

original: sbyin pa la dpa' ba /
analyzed: sbyin pa la dpa' ba /
translated: a hero of generosity,

original: tshul khrims la dpa' ba /🔽bzod pa la dpa' ba /
analyzed: tshul khrims la dpa' ba / bzod pa la dpa' ba /
translated: He is a hero of discipline.🔽He is a hero of patience.

original: brtson 'grus la dpa' ba /
analyzed: brtson 'grus la dpa' ba /
translated: He is a hero of perseverance.

original: bsam gtan la dpa' ba /
analyzed: bsam gtan la dpa' ba /
translated: He is a hero of concentration.

original: shes rab la dpa' ba /
analyzed: shes rab la dpa' ba /
translated: He is a hero of wisdom.

original: ting nge 'dzin la dpa' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la dpa' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: He is a hero of meditative absorption.

original: 'jam dpal / gal te byang chub sems dpa' de gsod pa'i mi de dag la mi khro zhing /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / gal te byang chub sems dpa' de gsod pa'i mi de dag la mi khro zhing /
translated: Mañjuśrī, if that bodhisattva does not get angry with those people who are trying to kill him,

original: thab dang / zhe sdang gi sems mi bskyed na /
analyzed: thab dang / zhe sdang gi sems mi bskyed na /
translated: and if he does not give rise to thoughts of contempt or hatred,

original: 'jam dpal / byang chub sems dpa' de ni tshangs pa dang mtshungs pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / byang chub sems dpa' de ni tshangs pa dang mtshungs pa /
