original: dbang po dang mtshungs pa /
analyzed: dbang po dang mtshungs pa /
translated: equal to Indra,

original: lhun po dang mtshungs pa /
analyzed: lhun po dang mtshungs pa /
translated: equal to Mount Meru,

original: mi g-yo ba /
analyzed: mi g-yo ba /
translated: immovable,

original: snying nrje dang ldan pa /
analyzed: snying nrje dang ldan pa /
translated: compassionate,

original: byams pa la gnas pa /
analyzed: byams pa la gnas pa /
translated: abiding in love,

original: sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa gso ba la mos pa /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa gso ba la mos pa /
translated: devoted to fulfilling the wishes of all sentient beings,

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i spyod yul ba /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i spyod yul ba /
translated: in the domain of non-returning,

original: sems dang mtshungs pa /
analyzed: sems dang mtshungs pa /
translated: equal to the mind,

original: sems chu dang mtshungs pa /
analyzed: sems chu dang mtshungs pa /
translated: with a mind like water,

original: sems me dang mtshungs pa /
analyzed: sems me dang mtshungs pa /
translated: with a mind like fire,

original: sems nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sems nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: and with a mind like space.

original: sems can thams cad kyi 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / tha ba sel ba'i phyir zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / tha ba sel ba'i phyir zhugs pa'o //
translated: They are dedicated to dispelling the desire, anger, ignorance, and harshness of all sentient beings.

original: 'jam dpal / gang gis gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi sangs rgyas rnams las sangs rgyas re re la'ang gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing nor bu rin po che dbang gi rgyal pos rab tu bkang ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / gang gis gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi sangs rgyas rnams las sangs rgyas re re la'ang gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing nor bu rin po che dbang gi rgyal pos rab tu bkang ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, suppose someone were to offer to as many buddhas as there are grains of sand in the river Ganges, and each buddha were to give as many buddhafields as there are grains of sand in the river Ganges, filled with the essence of the precious king of jewels,

original: dbul @309a *// ba phul la /
analyzed: dbul @309a *// ba phul la /
translated: and were to offer them as gifts,

original: de ltar dbul bas gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi bskal bar dbul ba phul ba bas /
analyzed: de ltar dbul bas gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi bskal bar dbul ba phul ba bas /
translated: and were to make such offerings for as many eons as there are grains of sand in the river Ganges.

original: 'jam dpal / byang chub sems dpa' gzhan gang gis rnam pa 'di lta bu'i chos 'di thos nas /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / byang chub sems dpa' gzhan gang gis rnam pa 'di lta bu'i chos 'di thos nas /
translated: Mañjuśrī, suppose another bodhisattva were to hear this kind of Dharma teaching,

original: phyogs gcig tu song ste /
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu song ste /
translated: and then go off to one side

original: 'di ltar sems kyis mngon par rtog cing 'di lta bu'i chos la bslab par bya'o zhes slob par 'dod na /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems kyis mngon par rtog cing 'di lta bu'i chos la bslab par bya'o zhes slob par 'dod na /
translated: and think, “I will train in this kind of Dharma.”

original: des ma bslabs su zin kyang bsod nams ches mang du skyed de /
analyzed: des ma bslabs su zin kyang bsod nams ches mang du skyed de /
translated: Even if he has not trained in it, he will still generate much more merit.

original: byang chub sems dpa' nor bu rin po che dbang gi rgyal po sbyin pa'i bsod nams ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' nor bu rin po che dbang gi rgyal po sbyin pa'i bsod nams ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: This is not the case with the merit of giving the precious jewel of the bodhicitta.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i sems bskyed ma thag pa des chos bzhi yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i sems bskyed ma thag pa des chos bzhi yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because as soon as he has given rise to the mind of awakening, he will uphold four qualities.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: byams pa yongs su bzung ba yin /
analyzed: byams pa yongs su bzung ba yin /
translated: He will uphold love.

original: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang; da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis bka' dang mi 'gal bar byas pa yin /
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang; da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis bka' dang mi 'gal bar byas pa yin /
translated: He will not contradict the words of the blessed buddhas of the past, present, and future.

original: de nan tan snying por byed pa yin /
analyzed: de nan tan snying por byed pa yin /
translated: He will make practice his essence.

original: myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba yin te /
analyzed: myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba yin te /
translated: He will swiftly awaken to unsurpassed and perfect buddhahood.

original: chos bzhi po de dag yongs su 'dzin to //
analyzed: chos bzhi po de dag yongs su 'dzin to //
translated: He will uphold these four qualities.

original: gzhan yang chos bzhi yongs su 'dzin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang chos bzhi yongs su 'dzin te /
translated: Moreover, he will uphold four qualities.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sgrib pa med pa'i blo'i rnam par thar pa yongs su 'dzin pa ste bzhi @309b po de dag go /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sgrib pa med pa'i blo'i rnam par thar pa yongs su 'dzin pa ste bzhi @309b po de dag go /
translated: They are (1) to be free of the two extremes, (2) to be free of the four māras, (3) to be free of the afflictions, and (4) to uphold the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the fourfold fearlessness, the four kinds of correct understanding, and the liberation of the unobstructed mind.

original: 'jam dpal / chos bzhi dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / chos bzhi dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, if bodhisattvas possess four qualities, they are called great bodhisattvas.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: dus su sbyin pa dang / g-yo med cing sgyu med pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pas byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang mi 'brel ba dang / sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la'ang shin tu gus pa ste chos bzhi po de dag dang ldan na /
analyzed: dus su sbyin pa dang / g-yo med cing sgyu med pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pas byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang mi 'brel ba dang / sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la'ang shin tu gus pa ste chos bzhi po de dag dang ldan na /
translated: They are (1) to give at the right time, (2) to be free of deceit and pretense, (3) to be inseparable from the generation of the mind of awakening with a higher motivation, and (4) to have great respect for bodhisattvas who have generated the mind of awakening for the first time.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: If they possess these four qualities, they are called great bodhisattvas.

original: 'jam dpal / gal te byang chub sems dpa' la rgyal po'am /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / gal te byang chub sems dpa' la rgyal po'am /
translated: Mañjuśrī, if a king or a king’s minister

original: blon po chen po gang zhig 'di skad ces gal te khyod sems can gcig gi don du dge ba'i rtsa ba gcig yang dag par bsgrubs te /
analyzed: blon po chen po gang zhig 'di skad ces gal te khyod sems can gcig gi don du dge ba'i rtsa ba gcig yang dag par bsgrubs te /
translated: A great minister might say, “If you practice a single root of virtue for the sake of a single being,

original: tha na dud 'gro'i skye gnas su song ba la zan chang gcig tsam sbyin zhing bsgrub na'ang de'i phyir ngas khyod kyi sha sen mos btogs te med par bya'o zhes zer la /🔽gal te byang chub sems dpa' de skad zer ba la mi skrag /
analyzed: tha na dud 'gro'i skye gnas su song ba la zan chang gcig tsam sbyin zhing bsgrub na'ang de'i phyir ngas khyod kyi sha sen mos btogs te med par bya'o zhes zer la / gal te byang chub sems dpa' de skad zer ba la mi skrag /
translated: even if it is only giving a single morsel of food to an animal, I will tear your flesh to pieces with my nails and destroy you.”🔽If a bodhisattva is not frightened,

original: mi dngang / dngang bar mi 'gyur zhing 'jigs pa med kyi /
analyzed: mi dngang / dngang bar mi 'gyur zhing 'jigs pa med kyi /
translated: terrified, or scared by such words, and is fearless,

original: 'di ltar sems skyed de /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems skyed de /
translated: and if he or she thinks,

original: gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi lus kyi sha sen mos bcad de bor yang bdag spro bar bya yi /
analyzed: gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi lus kyi sha sen mos bcad de bor yang bdag spro bar bya yi /
translated: “I would be happy if I were to cut off the flesh from my body, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river, and give it away,

original: bdag sems can gcig gi phyir yang ji tsam du chung ngu na'ang dge ba'i rtsa ba gcig yang dag par mi bsgrub tu mi gtang ngo snyam nas sems bskyed pa gcig po des byang chub sems dpa' des phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul snyed🔽@310a *// kyi gtan pa med pa'i mchod sbyin zil gyis gnon to //
analyzed: bdag sems can gcig gi phyir yang ji tsam du chung ngu na'ang dge ba'i rtsa ba gcig yang dag par mi bsgrub tu mi gtang ngo snyam nas sems bskyed pa gcig po des byang chub sems dpa' des phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul snyed @310a *// kyi gtan pa med pa'i mchod sbyin zil gyis gnon to //
translated: By that single generation of the thought, that bodhisattva surpasses the worship of the boundless offering of the ten directions, which is equal to the number of particles of all the world-realms.

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul phra rab kyi rdul snyed kyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sbyin pa las byung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyang zil gyis gnon te /
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul phra rab kyi rdul snyed kyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sbyin pa las byung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyang zil gyis gnon te /
translated: He surpasses the roots of virtue that arise from the giving of all the bodhisattvas of the ten directions, who are equal to the number of particles of all the subtle particles of the world-realms.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs par byang chub las phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs par byang chub las phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: He becomes irreversible from unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He experiences the state of a wheel-turning king as many times as there are grains of sand in the Ganges river.

original: de bzhin du gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi brgya byin dang / tshangs pa 'thob cing myong bar 'gyur ro; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi brgya byin dang / tshangs pa 'thob cing myong bar 'gyur ro; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: In the same way, he will experience the state of Indra and Brahma as many times as there are grains of sand in the Ganges river. And why?

original: 'jam dpal / byang chub sems dpa' gang gis sems can rnams la snying rje bskyed na de snying rje dang ldan pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba des chos bzhi yongs su 'dzin te /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / byang chub sems dpa' gang gis sems can rnams la snying rje bskyed na de snying rje dang ldan pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba des chos bzhi yongs su 'dzin te /
translated: Mañjuśrī, when a bodhisattva arouses compassion for sentient beings, through that wholesome root endowed with compassion, he embraces four qualities.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: brtan pa'i sems yongs su 'dzin pa dang / khong khro ba med pa'i sems dang / snying rje chen po yongs su 'dzin pa dang / phyin ci log gi shes pa spangs nas phyin ci ma log pa'i ye shes 'thob pa'o //
analyzed: brtan pa'i sems yongs su 'dzin pa dang / khong khro ba med pa'i sems dang / snying rje chen po yongs su 'dzin pa dang / phyin ci log gi shes pa spangs nas phyin ci ma log pa'i ye shes 'thob pa'o //
translated: He embraces a stable mind, a mind free from anger, the embrace of great compassion, and the attainment of unerring pristine awareness by abandoning mistaken cognition.

original: gzhan yang chos bzhi yongs su 'dzin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang chos bzhi yongs su 'dzin te /
translated: Moreover, he embraces four qualities.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa mchog yongs su 'dzin te /
analyzed: tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa mchog yongs su 'dzin te /
translated: He embraces the perfection of supreme ethical discipline.

original: tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa mchog de dang ldan pas byang chub sems dpa' lha gzhan la rton par mi 'gyur ba dang / dran pa phun @310b sum tshogs pa mchog 'thob ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa mchog de dang ldan pas byang chub sems dpa' lha gzhan la rton par mi 'gyur ba dang / dran pa phun @310b sum tshogs pa mchog 'thob ste /
translated: He attains the supreme perfection of mindfulness.🔽Endowed with that supreme perfection of mindfulness, the bodhisattva, when he is born, remembers his former lives.

original: dran pa phun sum tshogs pa mchog de dang ldan pas byang chub sems dpa' skye bar skye na tsho rabs dran par 'gyur ba dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen phun sum tshogs pa mchog yongs su 'dzin te /
analyzed: dran pa phun sum tshogs pa mchog de dang ldan pas byang chub sems dpa' skye bar skye na tsho rabs dran par 'gyur ba dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen phun sum tshogs pa mchog yongs su 'dzin te /
translated: He obtains the supreme perfection of spiritual friends.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen phun sum tshogs pa mchog de dang ldan pas byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas 'byung ba dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur /🔽sangs rgyas 'byung ba dang mi 'bral ba'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen phun sum tshogs pa mchog de dang ldan pas byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas 'byung ba dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur / sangs rgyas 'byung ba dang mi 'bral ba'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du skye bar 'gyur /
translated: Endowed with that supreme perfection of spiritual friends, the bodhisattva is never separated from the appearance of the Buddha.🔽He is born in a buddhafield where the Buddha is not absent.

original: gal te sangs rgyas ni ma byung la dzambu'i gling du skyes na'ang skyes bu dam par 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te sangs rgyas ni ma byung la dzambu'i gling du skyes na'ang skyes bu dam par 'gyur /
translated: If the Buddha has not appeared and he is born in Jambudvīpa, he becomes a holy man.

original: dzambu'i gling na sbyin pa'i gnas gcig pur 'gyur /
analyzed: dzambu'i gling na sbyin pa'i gnas gcig pur 'gyur /
translated: He will become the sole object of generosity in the world.

original: rang sangs rgyas dang / gzhan mngon par shes pa lnga dang ldan pa dang / 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba de dag mgu bar byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas dang / gzhan mngon par shes pa lnga dang ldan pa dang / 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba de dag mgu bar byed par 'gyur /
translated: He will please the pratyekabuddhas and others who possess the five superknowledges and are free from the attachments of the desire realm.

original: de dag mgu bar byas nas /
analyzed: de dag mgu bar byas nas /
translated: Having pleased them,

original: bsod snyoms 'bul bar 'gyur ba dang / lha rnams kyis yongs su bzung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bsod snyoms 'bul bar 'gyur ba dang / lha rnams kyis yongs su bzung bar 'gyur te /
translated: he will offer them alms, and he will be protected by the gods.

original: nam bag med par gyur pa de'i tshe'ang gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi lha'i bu rnams kyis bskul bar 'gyur /
analyzed: nam bag med par gyur pa de'i tshe'ang gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi lha'i bu rnams kyis bskul bar 'gyur /
translated: Even when he is careless, the gods of the pure realms will exhort him.

original: bskul nas kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la brtson 'grus rtsom par 'gyur /
analyzed: bskul nas kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la brtson 'grus rtsom par 'gyur /
translated: Having exhorted him, he will apply himself to unsurpassed and perfect awakening.

original: de'i dran pa chud mi za bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i dran pa chud mi za bar 'gyur /
translated: His mindfulness will not be lost.

original: byang chub yang dag par 'grub pa'i rgyur brtson 'grus rtsom par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub yang dag par 'grub pa'i rgyur brtson 'grus rtsom par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will apply himself to the practice of diligence, which is the cause for the attainment of awakening.

original: 'jam dpal / byang chub sems dpa' de @311a *//
analyzed: 'jam dpal / byang chub sems dpa' de @311a *//
translated: Mañjuśrī, a bodhisattva

original: sems bskyed pa des rnam par dag par byed pa'i chos lnga yongs su 'dzin te /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa des rnam par dag par byed pa'i chos lnga yongs su 'dzin te /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, through that generation of the mind of awakening, they will uphold the five dharmas that purify.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: tshul khrims rnam par dag pa yongs su 'dzin pa dang / lus rnam par dag pa dang / mtshan phun sum tshogs pa 'thob pa rnam par dag pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba sbyangs pa rnam par dag pa dang / sangs rgyas la brten /
analyzed: tshul khrims rnam par dag pa yongs su 'dzin pa dang / lus rnam par dag pa dang / mtshan phun sum tshogs pa 'thob pa rnam par dag pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba sbyangs pa rnam par dag pa dang / sangs rgyas la brten /
translated: They are upholding the purity of discipline, the purity of body, the purity of attaining the excellent marks, the purity of the purification of roots of virtue, and the purity of relying on the Buddha,

original: chos la brten /
analyzed: chos la brten /
translated: relying on the Dharma,

original: dge 'dun la brten /
analyzed: dge 'dun la brten /
translated: relying on the Saṅgha,

original: byang chub sems dpa' la brten /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la brten /
translated: relying on the bodhisattvas,

original: byang chub tu sems bskyed pa la brten pa yongs su 'dzin pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub tu sems bskyed pa la brten pa yongs su 'dzin pa yin te /
translated: and relying on the generation of the mind of awakening.

original: 'jam dpal / rnam par dag par byed pa'i chos de dag yongs su 'dzin par 'gyur ro //🔽'jam dpal / rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / rnam par dag par byed pa'i chos de dag yongs su 'dzin par 'gyur ro // 'jam dpal / rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Mañjuśrī, they will uphold those purifying dharmas.

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang la las dzambu gling ba'i sems can thams cad kyi srog bcad de /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang la las dzambu gling ba'i sems can thams cad kyi srog bcad de /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, if some son or daughter of noble family were to kill all the sentient beings of the Rose Apple Continent,

original: de dag gi bdog pa thams cad phrogs pa bas /
analyzed: de dag gi bdog pa thams cad phrogs pa bas /
translated: and were to steal all their possessions,

original: 'jam dpal / rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Mañjuśrī, if some son or daughter of noble family were to cause a bodhisattva to lose his or her life,

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang gzhan zhig gis byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i rtsa ba gcig gi sems bskyed pa /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang gzhan zhig gis byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i rtsa ba gcig gi sems bskyed pa /
translated: “If, on the other hand, a son or daughter of noble family were to create an obstacle for a bodhisattva who has given rise to a single thought of wholesome action,

original: tha na dud 'gro'i skye gnas su song ba la tha na zan chang gcig byin pa dang ldan pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i bar chad byas na /
analyzed: tha na dud 'gro'i skye gnas su song ba la tha na zan chang gcig byin pa dang ldan pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i bar chad byas na /
translated: even if it were only the wholesome action of giving a single mouthful of food to an animal,

original: de de bas ches sdig pa grangs med par skyed do //
analyzed: de de bas ches sdig pa grangs med par skyed do //
translated: they would create incalculably more vileness.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: sangs rgyas 'byung ba skyed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i bar chad byed par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'byung ba skyed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i bar chad byed par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they would be creating an obstacle for the wholesome action that gives rise to the buddhas.

original: 'jam dpal / rigs kyi bu'am rigs @311b kyi bu mo gang la la mdo sde dkon mchog sangs rgyas kyi ye shes skyed pa rnam pa 'di lta bu 'di la mos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la smod cing bsngags pa ma yin pa brjod /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / rigs kyi bu'am rigs @311b kyi bu mo gang la la mdo sde dkon mchog sangs rgyas kyi ye shes skyed pa rnam pa 'di lta bu 'di la mos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la smod cing bsngags pa ma yin pa brjod /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, if a son or daughter of noble family were to disparage a bodhisattva who has faith in this kind of precious discourse that gives rise to the wisdom of the buddhas, and were to speak ill of them,

original: 'dum par mi byed; dge ba'i rtsa ba dang bral bar byed de /
analyzed: 'dum par mi byed; dge ba'i rtsa ba dang bral bar byed de /
translated: not reconcile with them, and separate them from their wholesome actions,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba la mos pa dang bral bar byad cing bar chad byed na /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba la mos pa dang bral bar byad cing bar chad byed na /
translated: If they cause obstacles to those who are devoted to the roots of virtue,

original: de mi dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa des sems can dmyal ba chen po rnams su skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de mi dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa des sems can dmyal ba chen po rnams su skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then by that accumulation of roots of nonvirtue they will be born in the great hells.

original: de der skyes nas lus dpag tshad lnga brgya pa 'grub bo //
analyzed: de der skyes nas lus dpag tshad lnga brgya pa 'grub bo //
translated: Once born there, their bodies will be five hundred leagues tall.

original: lus de la'ang mgo lnga brgyar 'gyur ro //🔽mgo bo re re la'ang lce lnga rgya lnga brgyar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus de la'ang mgo lnga brgyar 'gyur ro // mgo bo re re la'ang lce lnga rgya lnga brgyar 'gyur ro //
translated: On those bodies there will be five hundred heads.🔽On each head there will be five hundred tongues.

original: lce re re la'ang thong shol lnga brgya lnga brgyas rmo bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: lce re re la'ang thong shol lnga brgya lnga brgyas rmo bar 'gyur te /
translated: On each tongue there will be five hundred plows.

original: bskal pa ji snyed cig gis byang chub sems dpa' de byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba de snyed kyi bskal par sems can dmyal ba chen po rnams su skyes nas sdug bsngal chen po myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bskal pa ji snyed cig gis byang chub sems dpa' de byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba de snyed kyi bskal par sems can dmyal ba chen po rnams su skyes nas sdug bsngal chen po myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: For as many eons as it takes that bodhisattva to fully awaken to unsurpassed and perfect buddhahood, for that many eons they will be born in the great hells and experience great suffering.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de sangs rgyas 'byung ba'i bar chad bya bar zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de sangs rgyas 'byung ba'i bar chad bya bar zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they have set out to create obstacles for the appearance of a buddha.

original: gang sangs rgyas 'byung ba'i bar chad bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa de sangs rgyas kyi rigs gcod pa'i phyir zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: gang sangs rgyas 'byung ba'i bar chad bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa de sangs rgyas kyi rigs gcod pa'i phyir zhugs pa'o //
translated: Whoever sets out to obstruct the appearance of a buddha sets out to cut off the lineage of the buddhas.

original: chos kyi rigs gcod pa'i phyir zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi rigs gcod pa'i phyir zhugs pa'o //
translated: Whoever sets out to obstruct the appearance of a buddha sets out to cut off the lineage of the Dharma.

original: dge 'dun gyi rigs gcod pa'i phyir zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi rigs gcod pa'i phyir zhugs pa'o //
translated: Whoever sets out to obstruct the appearance of a buddha sets out to cut off the lineage of the Saṅgha.

original: de lha'i rigs gcod pa'i phyir zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: de lha'i rigs gcod pa'i phyir zhugs pa'o //
translated: Whoever sets out to obstruct the appearance of a buddha sets out to cut off the lineage of the gods.

original: de tshangs pa thams cad kyi rigs gcod pa'i phyir zhugs pa'o //🔽de mi'i 'jig @312a *//
analyzed: de tshangs pa thams cad kyi rigs gcod pa'i phyir zhugs pa'o // de mi'i 'jig @312a *//
translated: Whoever sets out to obstruct the appearance of a buddha sets out to cut off the lineage of all Brahmās.

original: rten gcod pa'i phyir zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: rten gcod pa'i phyir zhugs pa'o //
translated: Whoever sets out to obstruct the appearance of a buddha sets out to cut off the human world.

original: de sems can thams cad kyi bde bar sbyar ba thams cad gcod pa'i phyir zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: de sems can thams cad kyi bde bar sbyar ba thams cad gcod pa'i phyir zhugs pa'o //
translated: Whoever sets out to obstruct the appearance of a buddha sets out to cut off the happiness of all sentient beings.

original: 'jam dpal; gang la la byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba gcod pa'i phyir 'jug pa de la rnam pa de lta bu'i sdug bsngal chen po skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jam dpal; gang la la byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba gcod pa'i phyir 'jug pa de la rnam pa de lta bu'i sdug bsngal chen po skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Mañjuśrī, whoever sets out to cut off the roots of virtue of a bodhisattva will experience suffering like that.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: byang chub sems dpa' de dag thams cad ni dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs thams cad kyis byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de dag thams cad ni dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs thams cad kyis byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: All those bodhisattvas will fully awaken to unsurpassed and perfect buddhahood through the accumulation of all roots of virtue.

original: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas kyang sems can rnams la chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu skor ro //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas kyang sems can rnams la chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu skor ro //
translated: Having fully awakened to unsurpassed and perfect buddhahood, they will turn the wheel of Dharma for sentient beings.

original: chos thos nas kyang rgyun du zhugs par 'gyur /
analyzed: chos thos nas kyang rgyun du zhugs par 'gyur /
translated: Having heard the Dharma, they will become stream-enterers,

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom par 'gyur /
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom par 'gyur /
translated: once-returners, non-returners, and arhats.

original: rang rgyal bar 'gyur /
analyzed: rang rgyal bar 'gyur /
translated: They will become pratyekabuddhas.

original: rgyal po chen po bzhir 'gyur /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po bzhir 'gyur /
translated: They will become the Four Great Kings.

original: sum cu rtsa gsum dang / 'thab bral ba dang / dga' ldan dang / 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lhar 'gyur /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum dang / 'thab bral ba dang / dga' ldan dang / 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lhar 'gyur /
translated: They will become gods in the Heaven of the Thirty-Three, the Yāma Heaven, the Tuṣita Heaven, the Nirmāṇarati Heaven, and the Para­nirmita­vaśa­vartin Heaven.

original: zla ba dang / nyi mar 'gyur /
analyzed: zla ba dang / nyi mar 'gyur /
translated: They will become the moon and the sun.

original: skar ma dang / rgyu skar dang / tshogs dang / tshogs kyi bdag po chen por 'gyur /
analyzed: skar ma dang / rgyu skar dang / tshogs dang / tshogs kyi bdag po chen por 'gyur /
translated: They will become the stars, the constellations, and the great lords of the gaṇas.

original: drag po dang / drag po chen por 'gyur /
analyzed: drag po dang / drag po chen por 'gyur /
translated: They will become Rudra and Mahā-Rudra.

original: sangs rgyas las brten te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas las brten te /
translated: Relying on the Buddha,

original: tshangs par 'gyur /
analyzed: tshangs par 'gyur /
translated: they will become Brahmā;

original: tshangs pa chen por 'gyur /
analyzed: tshangs pa chen por 'gyur /
translated: they will become Great Brahmā;

original: tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don du 'gyur /🔽'od chung dang / tshad med 'od dang / 'od gsal dang / dge chung dang / tshad med dge dang / dge rgyas pa dang / sbrin @312b med dang / bsod nams skyes dang / 'bras bu che dang / mi che dang / mi gdung dang /
analyzed: tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don du 'gyur / 'od chung dang / tshad med 'od dang / 'od gsal dang / dge chung dang / tshad med dge dang / dge rgyas pa dang / sbrin @312b med dang / bsod nams skyes dang / 'bras bu che dang / mi che dang / mi gdung dang /
translated: they will become a Brahma-king;

original: gya nom snang dang / shin tu mthong dang / 'og min gyi lha rnams su 'gyur /
analyzed: gya nom snang dang / shin tu mthong dang / 'og min gyi lha rnams su 'gyur /
translated: they will become a god in the Heaven of the Four Kings, the Heaven of the Thirty-Three, the Heaven Free from Strife, the Heaven of Joy, the Heaven of Delighting in Emanations, the Heaven of Making Use of Others’ Emanations, the Heaven of Little Light, the Heaven of Limitless Light, the Heaven of Radiant Light, the Heaven of Little Virtue, the Heaven of Limitless Virtue, the Heaven of Perfected Virtue, the Cloudless Heaven, the Heaven of Increased Merit, the Heaven of Great Fruit, the Heaven of No Hardship, the Heaven of Clear Vision, the Heaven of Perfect Vision, or the Highest Heaven.

original: sangs rgyas las brten te 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal por 'gyur /
analyzed: sangs rgyas las brten te 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal por 'gyur /
translated: They will become a universal monarch in dependence on the Buddha;

original: stobs kyi 'khor los bsgyur bar 'gyur /
analyzed: stobs kyi 'khor los bsgyur bar 'gyur /
translated: they will become a powerful universal monarch;

original: rgyal phran du 'gyur /
analyzed: rgyal phran du 'gyur /
translated: they will become a minor king;

original: drang srong mngon par shes pa lnga can 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur; sangs rgyas las brten te dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam 'jig rten du snang bar 'gyur /
analyzed: drang srong mngon par shes pa lnga can 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur; sangs rgyas las brten te dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam 'jig rten du snang bar 'gyur /
translated: they will become a sage with the five superknowledges in the world; they will make the path of the ten virtuous actions appear in the world in dependence on the Buddha;

original: sangs rgyas las brten te mi'i 'jig rten 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: sangs rgyas las brten te mi'i 'jig rten 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: they will make the human world appear in dependence on the Buddha.”

original: sangs rgyas las brten te skyid pa dang / nor che ba dang / mdzod mang ba dang / lus shin tu 'jam par 'gyur /
analyzed: sangs rgyas las brten te skyid pa dang / nor che ba dang / mdzod mang ba dang / lus shin tu 'jam par 'gyur /
translated: They will be happy, wealthy, have many treasuries, and have a very soft body.

original: glang po ches 'gro bar 'gyur /
analyzed: glang po ches 'gro bar 'gyur /
translated: They will travel by elephant,

original: rtas 'gro ba dang / dbung bu chung gis 'gro bar 'gyur ro; ;'jam dpal /
analyzed: rtas 'gro ba dang / dbung bu chung gis 'gro bar 'gyur ro; ;'jam dpal /
translated: by horse, and by chariot.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang la la gzhan gyi khyim rnams su byang chub sems dpa' la phrag dog dang / ser sna byed na des de'i tshe gzhi de las 'jigs pa chen po gsum shes par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang la la gzhan gyi khyim rnams su byang chub sems dpa' la phrag dog dang / ser sna byed na des de'i tshe gzhi de las 'jigs pa chen po gsum shes par bya ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, if a bodhisattva is jealous and stingy in other people’s homes, then at that time he should know about three great dangers.

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: sems can dmyal bar skye ba'i 'jigs pa dang / dmus long gi 'jigs pa dang / yul mtha' 'khob tu skye ba'i 'jigs pa dang / 'jigs pa gsum mo //
analyzed: sems can dmyal bar skye ba'i 'jigs pa dang / dmus long gi 'jigs pa dang / yul mtha' 'khob tu skye ba'i 'jigs pa dang / 'jigs pa gsum mo //
translated: The danger of being born in the hells, the danger of being born blind, and the danger of being born in the border regions—these are the three dangers.

original: 'jam dpal / gal te byang chub sems dpas bsod snyoms blangs te /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / gal te byang chub sems dpas bsod snyoms blangs te /
translated: Mañjuśrī, if a bodhisattva accepts alms

original: rid pa dang / phongs pa dang / sbrang po dang / slong ba rnams la bgos @313a *//
analyzed: rid pa dang / phongs pa dang / sbrang po dang / slong ba rnams la bgos @313a *//
translated: and shares them with the poor, the destitute, the beggars, and the unfortunate,

original: te byin na de dge ba'i rtsa ba des tshe brjes nas 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po rdzu 'phrul chen po dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: te byin na de dge ba'i rtsa ba des tshe brjes nas 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po rdzu 'phrul chen po dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: If he gives it away, then by that root of virtue, after he has passed away, he will become a universal monarch who possesses great magical power.

original: 'jam dpal / gal te byang chub sems dpa' khyim pa la chos ston cing snying rje bas don du 'dod /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / gal te byang chub sems dpa' khyim pa la chos ston cing snying rje bas don du 'dod /
translated: Mañjuśrī, if a householder bodhisattva teaches the Dharma to others, and out of compassion he desires their benefit,

original: phan par 'dod /
analyzed: phan par 'dod /
translated: desires their well-being,

original: sems can de dag la bde ba dang / grub par 'dod kyi rnyed pa dang / bkur sti don du mi gnyer na de dge ba'i rtsa ba des shes rab rno bar 'gyur /
analyzed: sems can de dag la bde ba dang / grub par 'dod kyi rnyed pa dang / bkur sti don du mi gnyer na de dge ba'i rtsa ba des shes rab rno bar 'gyur /
translated: and desires their happiness and success, but does not pursue gain and honor, then by that root of virtue, he will have sharp wisdom,

original: 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po rdzu 'phrul chen po dang ldan par 'gyur /🔽brgya byin rdzu 'phrul chen po dang ldan par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po rdzu 'phrul chen po dang ldan par 'gyur / brgya byin rdzu 'phrul chen po dang ldan par 'gyur /
translated: will become a universal monarch who possesses great magical power,🔽will become Śakra who possesses great magical power,

original: tshangs pa rdzu 'phrul chen po dang ldan par 'gyur /
analyzed: tshangs pa rdzu 'phrul chen po dang ldan par 'gyur /
translated: will become Brahmā who possesses great magical power,

original: mi'i dam pa sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi'i dam pa sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro //
translated: and will become a buddha, the best of humans.

original: 'jam dpal / gal te byang chub sems dpa' sdug bsngal ba'i sems can mthong na snying rje skyed cig /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / gal te byang chub sems dpa' sdug bsngal ba'i sems can mthong na snying rje skyed cig /
translated: Mañjuśrī, if a bodhisattva sees suffering sentient beings, he should generate compassion.

original: bde ba'i sems can mthong na mchog tu dga' ba skyed na de tshe brjes nas dge ba'i rtsa ba des lus gser gyi mdog can du 'gyur ro ////
analyzed: bde ba'i sems can mthong na mchog tu dga' ba skyed na de tshe brjes nas dge ba'i rtsa ba des lus gser gyi mdog can du 'gyur ro ////
translated: When they see happy sentient beings, they generate supreme joy. At that time, having changed, by that root of virtue, their bodies will become the color of gold.

original: bam po gsum pa ste tha ma /
analyzed: bam po gsum pa ste tha ma /
translated: Chapter 3: The Noble Path

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta said this to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: gang du 'phags pa'i lam brjod par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang du 'phags pa'i lam brjod par 'gyur /
translated: where is the noble path described?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: 'du byed yod pa la 'phags pa'i lam brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'du byed yod pa la 'phags pa'i lam brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: “The noble path is described in the existence of formations.

original: 'phags pa'i @313b lam yang gnas pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i @313b lam yang gnas pa med pa'o //
translated: The noble path is also without abode.

original: gnas med pa la rnam par shes pa gnas pa med do //
analyzed: gnas med pa la rnam par shes pa gnas pa med do //
translated: Where there is no abode, consciousness does not abide.

original: rnam par shes pa gnas pa med na 'phags pa'i lam la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gnas pa med na 'phags pa'i lam la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When consciousness does not abide, it is called ‘abiding in the noble path.’

original: 'phags pa'i lam gyi gnas gang yin pa de ni mig gi gnas /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam gyi gnas gang yin pa de ni mig gi gnas /
translated: The abode of the noble path is the abode of the eye,

original: rna ba'i gnas /
analyzed: rna ba'i gnas /
translated: the abode of the ear,

original: sna'i gnas / lce'i gnas /
analyzed: sna'i gnas / lce'i gnas /
translated: the abode of the nose, the abode of the tongue,

original: lus kyi gnas /
analyzed: lus kyi gnas /
translated: the abode of the body,

original: yid kyi gnas so //
analyzed: yid kyi gnas so //
translated: and the abode of the mind.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mig ni mig gis dben no //
analyzed: mig ni mig gis dben no //
translated: The eye is empty of the eye.

original: de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid ni yid kyis dben no //
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid ni yid kyis dben no //
translated: In the same way, the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind are empty of the mind.

original: cis dben zhe na /🔽'das pas dben no //
analyzed: cis dben zhe na / 'das pas dben no //
translated: In what way are they empty?🔽They are empty of the past.

original: ma 'ongs pas dben no //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pas dben no //
translated: They are empty of the future.

original: da ltar byung bas dben no //
analyzed: da ltar byung bas dben no //
translated: They are empty of the present.

original: mig gi dben pa la mig gi dben pa yod pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: mig gi dben pa la mig gi dben pa yod pa'ang ma yin /
translated: The emptiness of the eye is not the eye.

original: med pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: med pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: It is not nonexistent.

original: de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi dben pa la yid kyi dben pa yod pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi dben pa la yid kyi dben pa yod pa'ang ma yin /
translated: In the same way, the emptiness of the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind is not the mind.

original: med pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: med pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: It is not nonexistent.

original: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos kyi dben pa la chos kyi dben pa yod pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos kyi dben pa la chos kyi dben pa yod pa'ang ma yin /
translated: The emptiness of form, sound, smell, taste, texture, and mental phenomena is not mental phenomena.

original: med pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: med pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: It is not nonexistent.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bdag dang / bdag gi dang / rtag pa dang / brtan pa dang / ther zug dang / mi 'gyur ba'i chos can shin tu dben pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bdag dang / bdag gi dang / rtag pa dang / brtan pa dang / ther zug dang / mi 'gyur ba'i chos can shin tu dben pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is because of the emptiness of self and being mine, permanence, stability, and changelessness.

original: stong pa zhes kyang mi brjod /
analyzed: stong pa zhes kyang mi brjod /
translated: It is not called empty.

original: mi stong pa zhes kyang mi brjod kyi /🔽de ni 'das pa zhes kyang mi brjod la /
analyzed: mi stong pa zhes kyang mi brjod kyi / de ni 'das pa zhes kyang mi brjod la /
translated: It is not called non-empty.🔽It is not called past.

original: 'das pa ma yin pa zhes kyang mi brjod do //🔽ma 'ongs pa zhes kyang mi brjod la /
analyzed: 'das pa ma yin pa zhes kyang mi brjod do // ma 'ongs pa zhes kyang mi brjod la /
translated: It is not called not past.🔽It is not called future.

original: ma 'ongs pa ma yin pa zhes kyang mi brjod @314a *//
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ma yin pa zhes kyang mi brjod @314a *//
translated: It is not called not future.

original: do; ;da ltar byung ba zhes kyang mi brjod la /
analyzed: do; ;da ltar byung ba zhes kyang mi brjod la /
translated: It is not called present.

original: da ltar byung ba ma yin pa zhes kyang mi brjod do //🔽'di ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba zhes kyang mi brjod la /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba ma yin pa zhes kyang mi brjod do // 'di ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba zhes kyang mi brjod la /
translated: It is not called not present.🔽It is not called past, future, or present.

original: brjod pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: brjod pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: It is not even called inexpressible.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'di ni 'das pas stong ngo //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di ni 'das pas stong ngo //
translated: Why is that?🔽It is empty of the past.

original: ma 'ongs pas stong ngo //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pas stong ngo //
translated: It is empty of the future.

original: da ltar byung bas stong ngo //
analyzed: da ltar byung bas stong ngo //
translated: It is empty of the present.

original: gang 'das pas stong pa dang / ma 'ongs pas stong pa dang / da ltar byung bas stong pa de ni 'das pas dag pa'o //
analyzed: gang 'das pas stong pa dang / ma 'ongs pas stong pa dang / da ltar byung bas stong pa de ni 'das pas dag pa'o //
translated: That which is empty of the past, empty of the future, and empty of the present is purified by the past,

original: ma 'ongs pas dag pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pas dag pa'o //
translated: purified by the future,🔽and purified by the present.

original: da ltar byung bas dag go /
analyzed: da ltar byung bas dag go /
translated: It is purified by the present.

original: 'jam dpal / 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: Mañjuśrī, what do you think?

original: gang gzhom pa ma yin pa de gzhom par nus sam /
analyzed: gang gzhom pa ma yin pa de gzhom par nus sam /
translated: Can that which is not to be conquered be conquered?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He replied, “Blessed One,

original: de ni mi nus so //
analyzed: de ni mi nus so //
translated: it cannot.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni mnyam pa lags te /
analyzed: de ni mnyam pa lags te /
translated: It is equal,

original: nam du'ang mi mnyam par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nam du'ang mi mnyam par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and will never be unequal.”

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin te /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin te /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is so.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas mi mnyam pa med par chos bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas mi mnyam pa med par chos bstan to //
translated: The Thus-Gone One teaches the Dharma without any inequality.

original: 'jam dpal / gang mi mnyam pa med na mi gzhom pa'o //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / gang mi mnyam pa med na mi gzhom pa'o //
translated: Mañjuśrī, that which is without inequality is unconquerable.

original: gang gzhom pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: gang gzhom pa ma yin zhing /
translated: That which is unconquerable

original: mnyam pa de ni mi mnyam pa med pa'o //🔽ltos pa med pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa de ni mi mnyam pa med pa'o // ltos pa med pa'o //
translated: and equal is without inequality.🔽It is without dependence.

original: 'jug pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa med pa'o //
translated: It is without engagement.

original: 'gro ba med pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba med pa'o //
translated: It is without going.

original: 'gro ba yang dag par chad pa'o //🔽shes par bya ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba yang dag par chad pa'o // shes par bya ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is the cessation of going.🔽It is not to be known.

original: gang dag gis shes par bya ba ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang dag gis shes par bya ba ma yin zhe na /
translated: By whom is it not to be known?

original: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid rnams kyis shes par bya ba ma @314b yin no;/
analyzed: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid rnams kyis shes par bya ba ma @314b yin no;/
translated: It is not to be known by the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, or mind.

original: 'du byed du gyur pa thams cad kyis shes par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'du byed du gyur pa thams cad kyis shes par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not to be known by any conditioned thing.

original: de ni lus kyi 'du byed dang / dag gi 'du byed dang / yid kyi 'du byed 'gags pa'o //
analyzed: de ni lus kyi 'du byed dang / dag gi 'du byed dang / yid kyi 'du byed 'gags pa'o //
translated: It is the cessation of the bodily, verbal, and mental formations.

original: ci'i rgyus 'gag /
analyzed: ci'i rgyus 'gag /
translated: Why does it cease?

original: ci sngon byung ba la de dag phyis 'gags pa zhig gam /
analyzed: ci sngon byung ba la de dag phyis 'gags pa zhig gam /
translated: Is it that what has arisen previously ceases later?

original: 'on te 'das pa ni zhig pas 'gags sam /
analyzed: 'on te 'das pa ni zhig pas 'gags sam /
translated: Or does the past cease because it has perished?

original: gang zhig pas 'gags /
analyzed: gang zhig pas 'gags /
translated: What is it that ceases?

original: de sngon mi shes pa la rab tu gnas pas mi dge ba'i las mngon par 'du byed do //
analyzed: de sngon mi shes pa la rab tu gnas pas mi dge ba'i las mngon par 'du byed do //
translated: Because of previously abiding in ignorance, one creates nonvirtuous karma.

original: de shes nas mngon par 'du mi byed do //
analyzed: de shes nas mngon par 'du mi byed do //
translated: Having understood that, one does not create it.

original: gang sngon 'phags pa'i chos la ma brten te /
analyzed: gang sngon 'phags pa'i chos la ma brten te /
translated: Previously, one did not rely on the Dharma of the noble ones.🔽Abiding in ignorance, one created nonvirtuous karma.

original: mi shes pa la rab tu gnas pas mi dge ba'i las byed pa de 'phags pa'i lam la brten te /
analyzed: mi shes pa la rab tu gnas pas mi dge ba'i las byed pa de 'phags pa'i lam la brten te /
translated: Relying on the path of the noble ones,

original: ye shes kyis rtogs nas mngon par 'du byed do //
analyzed: ye shes kyis rtogs nas mngon par 'du byed do //
translated: one understands with wisdom and does not create it.

original: gang ye shes kyis stong pa de stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: gang ye shes kyis stong pa de stong pa nyid de /
translated: That which is empty of pristine consciousness is emptiness.

original: mig ni ye shes kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: mig ni ye shes kyis stong ngo //
translated: The eye is empty of pristine consciousness.

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyang de bzhin no //
translated: The ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind are also like that.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ye shes ni ye shes kyis stong ste /
analyzed: ye shes ni ye shes kyis stong ste /
translated: Pristine consciousness is empty of pristine consciousness.

original: stong pa nyid mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang yid do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang yid do //
translated: Emptiness is the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind.

original: yid mi dmigs pas mig mig la mi gnas so //
analyzed: yid mi dmigs pas mig mig la mi gnas so //
translated: Since the mind is not observed, the eye does not exist in the eye.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: shin tu ma skyes pa'i phyir mig mi gnas te /
analyzed: shin tu ma skyes pa'i phyir mig mi gnas te /
translated: The eye does not exist because it is utterly non-arisen.

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyang de bzhin no //
translated: The ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind are also like that.

original: yid mi dmigs pas mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyang yid la mi gnas so //
analyzed: yid mi dmigs pas mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyang yid la mi gnas so //
translated: Since the mind is not observed, the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind do not exist in the mind.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mig shin @315a *//
analyzed: mig shin @315a *//
translated: The eye

original: tu ma skyes pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: tu ma skyes pa'i phyir te /
translated: is utterly non-arisen.

original: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyang mi gnas so //
analyzed: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyang mi gnas so //
translated: The eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind do not exist.

original: de mi gnas pas bsil bar gyur pa /
analyzed: de mi gnas pas bsil bar gyur pa /
translated: Since it is not located anywhere, it is cool.

original: dpen pa'i sems kyis gnas so //
analyzed: dpen pa'i sems kyis gnas so //
translated: It is located in the mind of solitude.

original: dpen pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: dpen pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is solitude?

original: 'jam dpal / gang chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi mtha' dang / gnyis su med pa'i mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / shin tu 'byung ba med pa'i mtha' de ni dben pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / gang chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi mtha' dang / gnyis su med pa'i mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / shin tu 'byung ba med pa'i mtha' de ni dben pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Mañjuśrī, that which is the limit of the sameness of all phenomena, the limit of nonduality, the limit of reality, and the limit of complete non-arising, that is called solitude.

original: 'jam dpal / dben pa ni skye ba dang / rga ba dang / 'chi ba med do //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / dben pa ni skye ba dang / rga ba dang / 'chi ba med do //
translated: Mañjuśrī, solitude is free from birth, aging, and death.

original: gang la skye ba dang / rga ba dang / 'chi ba med pa de la sdug bsngal med do //
analyzed: gang la skye ba dang / rga ba dang / 'chi ba med pa de la sdug bsngal med do //
translated: That which is free from birth, aging, and death is free from suffering.

original: gang la sdug bsngal med pa de la sdug bsngal mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gang la sdug bsngal med pa de la sdug bsngal mi 'byung ngo //
translated: That which is free from suffering does not arise as suffering.

original: gang la sdug bsngal mi 'byung ba de 'jigs pa med do //🔽gang 'jigs pa med pa de sems dang / rnam par shes pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: gang la sdug bsngal mi 'byung ba de 'jigs pa med do // gang 'jigs pa med pa de sems dang / rnam par shes pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: That which does not arise as suffering is fearless.🔽That which is fearless is free from mind and consciousness.

original: gang sems dang / rnam par shes pa dang bral ba de ni ma skyes ma 'gags pa'o //
analyzed: gang sems dang / rnam par shes pa dang bral ba de ni ma skyes ma 'gags pa'o //
translated: That which is free from mind and consciousness is unborn and unceasing.

original: gang ma skyes pa ma 'gags pa de dben pa ste /
analyzed: gang ma skyes pa ma 'gags pa de dben pa ste /
translated: What is unborn and unceasing is void.

original: de dang / des gnas pas de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dben par gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dang / des gnas pas de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dben par gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since the Tathāgata abides in that, he is said to abide in voidness.

original: 'jam dpal; de bzhin gshegs pa gnas pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'jam dpal; de bzhin gshegs pa gnas pa med pa'o //
translated: Mañjuśrī, the Tathāgata does not abide.

original: de bzhin gshegs par brtags pa ni brtags pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs par brtags pa ni brtags pa med pa'o //
translated: The Tathāgata is beyond conceptualization.

original: chos thams cad mi mthong ba ni de bzhin gshegs @315b pa mthong ba'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad mi mthong ba ni de bzhin gshegs @315b pa mthong ba'o //
translated: Not seeing any phenomena is seeing the Tathāgata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshig ni tshig thams cad las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshig ni tshig thams cad las 'das pa ste /
translated: The Tathāgata’s words are beyond all words.

original: bstan du med pa'o //
analyzed: bstan du med pa'o //
translated: They are not demonstrable.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'jam dpal / ngas ni chos thams cad kyi yi ge dang / nges pa'i tshig gis bstan pa 'gag pa'i phyir chos ston gyi /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / ngas ni chos thams cad kyi yi ge dang / nges pa'i tshig gis bstan pa 'gag pa'i phyir chos ston gyi /
translated: Mañjuśrī, I teach the Dharma in order to stop the teaching of all phenomena through letters and definitions.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pa ni yi ge gcig kyang mi brjod do //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pa ni yi ge gcig kyang mi brjod do //
translated: Mañjuśrī, the Tathāgata does not speak even a single letter.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la sems kyi 'jug pa med do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la sems kyi 'jug pa med do //
translated: The Tathāgata has no mental engagement.

original: sems kyi las med do //🔽sems las nges par sems pa med do //
analyzed: sems kyi las med do // sems las nges par sems pa med do //
translated: There is no mental activity.🔽There is no mind that is certain.

original: sems kyi rgyu ba med do //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyu ba med do //
translated: There is no movement of the mind.

original: sems yongs su rtogs pa med do //
analyzed: sems yongs su rtogs pa med do //
translated: There is no realization of the mind.

original: sems kyi zhi gnas med do //
analyzed: sems kyi zhi gnas med do //
translated: There is no mental stillness.

original: sems kyi rjes su 'brang ba rnam par shes pa med do //
analyzed: sems kyi rjes su 'brang ba rnam par shes pa med do //
translated: There is no consciousness that follows the mind.

original: rang gi sems kyi gnas med do //
analyzed: rang gi sems kyi gnas med do //
translated: There is no abode of one’s own mind.

original: gzhan gyi sems kyi gnas med do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems kyi gnas med do //
translated: There is no abode of another’s mind.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'i sems med do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'i sems med do //
translated: The Tathāgata has no mind that abides in form, feeling, perception, formation, or consciousness.

original: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid la gnas pa'i sems med do //
analyzed: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid la gnas pa'i sems med do //
translated: He has no mind that abides in the eyes, ears, nose, tongue, body, or mind.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos la gnas pa'i sems med do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos la gnas pa'i sems med do //
translated: The Tathāgata has no mind that abides in forms, sounds, smells, tastes, textures, or mental phenomena.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na; 'jam dpal /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na; 'jam dpal /
translated: Why is that? Mañjuśrī,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni zhi ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni zhi ba'o //
translated: the Tathāgata is peace.

original: bsil bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: bsil bar gyur pa'o //
translated: He is cool.

original: rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: He is always in equipoise.

original: mi snang ba'o //
analyzed: mi snang ba'o //
translated: He is not visible.

original: bltar med pa'o //
analyzed: bltar med pa'o //
translated: He is not seen.

original: mtha' yas pa'o //
analyzed: mtha' yas pa'o //
translated: He is infinite.

original: @316a *// sprin dang mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: @316a *// sprin dang mtshungs pa'o //
translated: He is like a cloud.

original: de lta mod kyi 'on kyang sems can rnams sngon dge ba'i rtsa ba'i stobs bskyed pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sngon gyi smon lam dang / spyod pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: de lta mod kyi 'on kyang sems can rnams sngon dge ba'i rtsa ba'i stobs bskyed pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sngon gyi smon lam dang / spyod pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ngo //
translated: Nevertheless, sentient beings see the Tathāgata through the power of their own previously generated roots of virtue, and through the Tathāgata’s previous aspirations and the power of his conduct.

original: nges par sems so //🔽kun tu 'dri'o //
analyzed: nges par sems so // kun tu 'dri'o //
translated: They definitely think,🔽‘I have seen the Tathāgata.’

original: gang dag ji ltar dbang po yongs su smin pa'i sems can rnams dang / gang dag ji ltar 'dul ba de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa de ltar gsung 'byin par shes so //
analyzed: gang dag ji ltar dbang po yongs su smin pa'i sems can rnams dang / gang dag ji ltar 'dul ba de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa de ltar gsung 'byin par shes so //
translated: Those sentient beings whose faculties are fully ripened, and those who are to be guided in such a way, know that the Tathāgata speaks in that way.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ma skyes ma 'gags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ma skyes ma 'gags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the Tathāgata is unborn and unceasing.

original: gang chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin mi mthong ba de ni de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba'o //
analyzed: gang chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin mi mthong ba de ni de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba'o //
translated: One who does not see the nature of all phenomena sees the Tathāgata.

original: gang chos gang yang mi mthong ba de ni de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba'o //
analyzed: gang chos gang yang mi mthong ba de ni de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba'o //
translated: Whoever does not see any dharma sees the Tathāgata.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos thams cad spangs pa ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos thams cad spangs pa ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, the Tathāgata has abandoned all dharmas.

original: chos gang gis kyang brjod pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: chos gang gis kyang brjod pa'ang ma yin /
translated: He is not described by any dharma.

original: mi brjod pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: mi brjod pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: He is not indescribable.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos thams cad dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all dharmas are unobservable.

original: gang chos thams cad dang / chos ma yin pa rnams dang / 'dus byas rnams dang / 'dus ma byas pa rnams mi dmigs pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba'o //
analyzed: gang chos thams cad dang / chos ma yin pa rnams dang / 'dus byas rnams dang / 'dus ma byas pa rnams mi dmigs pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba'o //
translated: Whoever does not observe any dharma, any nondharma, any compounded thing, or any uncompounded thing sees the Tathāgata.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos thams @316b cad spangs pa ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos thams @316b cad spangs pa ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, the Tathāgata has abandoned all dharmas.

original: chos gang yang khas mi len to //🔽nye bar mi len to //
analyzed: chos gang yang khas mi len to // nye bar mi len to //
translated: He does not accept any dharma.

original: chos su btags pa'ang mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: chos su btags pa'ang mi 'gro'o //
translated: He does not appropriate any dharma.🔽He does not go to any dharma label.

original: 'jam dpal / chos thams cad shin tu 'gag pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / chos thams cad shin tu 'gag pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas te /
translated: Mañjuśrī, the Thus-Gone One, the Worthy One, the Perfect Buddha is the complete cessation of all phenomena.

original: chos thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba'o //
translated: Seeing all phenomena as they are is seeing the Thus-Gone One.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'jam dpal; de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos gang gis kyang mthong bar mi 'gro ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal; de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos gang gis kyang mthong bar mi 'gro ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, the Thus-Gone One is not seen by any phenomenon.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de ltar mthong na chos thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o zhes 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de ltar mthong na chos thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o zhes 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the Thus-Gone One is seen in that way, one will engage with the thought, ‘All phenomena are the Thus-Gone One.’

original: chos thams cad ni de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid dang / ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa'o zhes 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid dang / ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa'o zhes 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will engage with the thought, ‘All phenomena are suchness, unmistaken suchness, unaltered suchness, unborn, and unceasing.’

original: yul med pa yul dang bral ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul lo zhes 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul med pa yul dang bral ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul lo zhes 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will engage with the thought, ‘The Thus-Gone One’s object is without object and free from object.’

original: 'jam dpal / ting nge 'dzin 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sems gcig gis sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa rab tu shes so //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / ting nge 'dzin 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sems gcig gis sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa rab tu shes so //
translated: Mañjuśrī, the bodhisattva who is established in this meditative absorption will, with a single thought, know the mental activity of all sentient beings.

original: de rang gi sems mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir sems can thams cad kyi sems mnyam pa nyid du khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rang gi sems mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir sems can thams cad kyi sems mnyam pa nyid du khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because he has realized the sameness of his own mind, he will realize the sameness of the minds of all sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad kyi sems mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir rang gi sems mnyam pa nyid du khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sems mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir rang gi sems mnyam pa nyid du khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because he has realized the sameness of the minds of all sentient beings, he will realize the sameness of his own mind.

original: de ci'i phyir @317a *//
analyzed: de ci'i phyir @317a *//
translated: Why is this?

original: zhe na; sems sgyu ma lta bu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhe na; sems sgyu ma lta bu'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the mind is like an illusion.

original: sems can thams cad kyi sems rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sems rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the minds of all sentient beings are naturally luminous.

original: de rang gi lus chos nyid kyi phyir sems can thams cad kyi lus chos nyid du khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rang gi lus chos nyid kyi phyir sems can thams cad kyi lus chos nyid du khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because he has realized the dharmatā of his own body, he will realize the dharmatā of the bodies of all sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad kyi lus chos nyid kyi phyir rang gi lus chos nyid du khong du chud par 'gyur ro; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi lus chos nyid kyi phyir rang gi lus chos nyid du khong du chud par 'gyur ro; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: They understand their own bodies to be the reality of all beings’ bodies. And why?

original: lus thams cad ni gzugs brnyan lta bu'i phyir rang gi lus la sems can thams cad kyi lus 'jug cing yang dag par 'du'o //
analyzed: lus thams cad ni gzugs brnyan lta bu'i phyir rang gi lus la sems can thams cad kyi lus 'jug cing yang dag par 'du'o //
translated: Because all bodies are like reflections, and so all beings’ bodies enter and are included in their own bodies.

original: sems can thams cad kyi lus la'ang rang gi lus rjes su 'jug cing yang dag par 'du'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi lus la'ang rang gi lus rjes su 'jug cing yang dag par 'du'o //
translated: And their own bodies enter and are included in all beings’ bodies.

original: 'dul ba ji lta ba bzhin du sems can thams cad kyi lus la sangs rgyas kyi sku byin gyis rlob ste /
analyzed: 'dul ba ji lta ba bzhin du sems can thams cad kyi lus la sangs rgyas kyi sku byin gyis rlob ste /
translated: In accordance with the training, they bless the bodies of all beings with the body of the Buddha.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'ang de bzhin no //
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'ang de bzhin no //
translated: The same is true of the vehicles of the hearers and solitary buddhas.

original: rang gi lus dang / rang gi lus ma yin pa dang / zhing gi tshogs byin gyis rlob bo //
analyzed: rang gi lus dang / rang gi lus ma yin pa dang / zhing gi tshogs byin gyis rlob bo //
translated: They bless their own bodies and the bodies of others, and the hosts of realms.

original: de bzhin du sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams kyang ji ltar 'dod pa de bzhin du byin gyis rlob ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams kyang ji ltar 'dod pa de bzhin du byin gyis rlob ste /
translated: In the same way, he can transform the earth element, the water element, the fire element, and the wind element as he wishes.

original: chu'i khams dang / sa'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams su byin gyis rlob bo //
analyzed: chu'i khams dang / sa'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams su byin gyis rlob bo //
translated: He can transform the water element, the earth element, the fire element, and the wind element as he wishes.

original: me'i khams dang / sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / rlung gi khams su byin gyis rlob bo /
analyzed: me'i khams dang / sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / rlung gi khams su byin gyis rlob bo /
translated: He can transform the fire element, the earth element, the water element, and the wind element as he wishes.

original: rlung gi khams dang / sa'i @317b khams dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams su byin gyis rlob bo //🔽de'i byin gyis brlabs de ni brgya byin nam /
analyzed: rlung gi khams dang / sa'i @317b khams dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams su byin gyis rlob bo // de'i byin gyis brlabs de ni brgya byin nam /
translated: He can transform the wind element, the earth element, the water element, and the fire element as he wishes.

original: tshangs pa'am / bdud dam /
analyzed: tshangs pa'am / bdud dam /
translated: “There is no one in the world, no god, Māra, Brahmā, or anyone else,

original: gzhan gang gis kyang 'jig rten na chos dang mthun par bskul ba'am /
analyzed: gzhan gang gis kyang 'jig rten na chos dang mthun par bskul ba'am /
translated: who can oppose or dispute with him in accordance with the Dharma.

original: spyod par nus pa'i de lta bu'i gnas med do //
analyzed: spyod par nus pa'i de lta bu'i gnas med do //
translated: There is no one who can do that.

original: 'jam dpal / spyod pa 'di la mos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i gzugs la so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / mngon par shes pa drug dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / byin gyi rlabs bzhi yang dag par 'jug go /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / spyod pa 'di la mos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i gzugs la so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / mngon par shes pa drug dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / byin gyi rlabs bzhi yang dag par 'jug go /
translated: Mañjuśrī, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who is devoted to this conduct will correctly engage with the four detailed and thorough knowledges, the six higher perceptions, the thirty-seven factors of awakening, and the four blessings in relation to form.

original: 'jam dpal; byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lus la so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / mngon par shes pa drug dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / byin gyi rlabs bzhi ji ltar yang dag par 'jug ce na /
analyzed: 'jam dpal; byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lus la so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / mngon par shes pa drug dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / byin gyi rlabs bzhi ji ltar yang dag par 'jug ce na /
translated: Mañjuśrī, how do the four detailed and thorough knowledges, the six higher perceptions, the thirty-seven factors of awakening, and the four blessings correctly engage with the bodhisattva mahāsattva’s body?

original: 'jam dpal / gang gzugs mi dmigs pa'i shes pa de ni don so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / gang gzugs mi dmigs pa'i shes pa de ni don so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
translated: Mañjuśrī, the knowledge that does not apprehend form is the detailed and thorough knowledge of meaning.

original: gang don ji lta ba bzhin du rton pa de ni chos so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
analyzed: gang don ji lta ba bzhin du rton pa de ni chos so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
translated: The reliance on meaning as it is is the detailed and thorough knowledge of phenomena.

translated: Since it is the analysis of the wisdom of the tathāgatas, it is the basis of supernormal knowledge that satisfies the minds of all sentient beings.

translated: It is the faith that all phenomena are not attained, that all observations of form are baseless, that the faculties are realized, and that phenomena are the equality of form and formlessness.

original: dbang po zhum pa med pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes la dad pa de ni dad pa'i dbang po zhes bya'o //

translated: It is the faith in the wisdom of the thus-gone ones that is not discouraged by the faculties. That is called the faculty of faith.

original: gdeg pa med pa dang / gzhag pa med pa'i tshul gyis gang gzugs la dmigs pa thams cad mgo gcig tu gyur pa dang / rnal 'byor gyi rgyun mi gcod pa de ni brtson 'grus zhes bya ste /

translated: It is the practice of yoga that is not interrupted by the single-pointedness of all observations of form, and that is not interrupted by the equality of form and formlessness.

original: mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes rgyun mi gcod pa ni brtson 'grus kyi dbang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes rgyun mi gcod pa ni brtson 'grus kyi dbang po zhes bya'o //
translated: It is the uninterrupted wisdom of the thus-gone ones that is not observed. That is called the faculty of diligence.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas la dbang po 'jug pa'i tshul gyis gang gzugs la dran pa med cing yid la byed pa med pa'i tshul gyis dmigs pa las shin tu 'das nas gcig dran te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas la dbang po 'jug pa'i tshul gyis gang gzugs la dran pa med cing yid la byed pa med pa'i tshul gyis dmigs pa las shin tu 'das nas gcig dran te /
translated: It is called mindfulness because it is the mindfulness that, in the manner of the faculties engaging the domain of the Thus-Gone One, transcends all reference by not being mindful of form and by not mentally engaging it, and is mindful of the one.

original: dus gsum mtshan nyid gcig tu dran pa de ni dran pa zhes bya ste /🔽sems can @320b thams cad kyi sems sems su mtshungs pas /
analyzed: dus gsum mtshan nyid gcig tu dran pa de ni dran pa zhes bya ste / sems can @320b thams cad kyi sems sems su mtshungs pas /
translated: It is called mindfulness because it is the mindfulness that is mindful of the single characteristic of the three times.

original: dmigs pa gcig gis sems can gyi khams thams cad khyab pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba'i byin gyi rlabs de ni dran pa'i dbang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa gcig gis sems can gyi khams thams cad khyab pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba'i byin gyi rlabs de ni dran pa'i dbang po zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the faculty of mindfulness because it is the faculty of mindfulness that pervades the realms of sentient beings with a single reference, since the minds of all sentient beings are the same in being mind, and because it is the faculty of mindfulness that is the blessing of seeing the Thus-Gone One.

original: skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / g-yeng ba med pa'i tshul gyis gang gzugs la yid la byed pa thams cad gcig pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dmigs pa gcig pa dang / mtshan nyid thams cad mtshan nyid gcig ste /
analyzed: skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / g-yeng ba med pa'i tshul gyis gang gzugs la yid la byed pa thams cad gcig pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dmigs pa gcig pa dang / mtshan nyid thams cad mtshan nyid gcig ste /
translated: It is called the faculty of mindfulness because it is the faculty of mindfulness that, in the manner of non-arising, non-cessation, and non-distraction, is the singularity of all mental engagements with form, the singularity of reference points in the concentrations of form and formlessness, and the singularity of all characteristics.

original: g-yeng ba med pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbang po la 'jug pa'i ye shes dang / rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin thun mong ma yin pa de ni ting nge 'dzin ces bya ste /
analyzed: g-yeng ba med pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbang po la 'jug pa'i ye shes dang / rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin thun mong ma yin pa de ni ting nge 'dzin ces bya ste /
translated: The absence of distraction, the wisdom that engages the faculties of the Thus-Gone One, and the uncommon vajra-like concentration are called “concentration.”

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad skye ba med pa'i tshul dang / g-yeng ba med cing mi thul bas ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad skye ba med pa'i tshul dang / g-yeng ba med cing mi thul bas ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po zhes bya'o //
translated: Since all concentrations are unborn, undistracted, and unconquerable, they are called the “faculty of concentration.”

original: gang gzugs la gnas med pa'i shes rab dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad dang / skye ba med pa'i mthar yang dag par 'dus pa'i spyod pa dang / chos thams cad skye ba med pa la 'jug pa'i shes rab kyis 'dus byas dang /
analyzed: gang gzugs la gnas med pa'i shes rab dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad dang / skye ba med pa'i mthar yang dag par 'dus pa'i spyod pa dang / chos thams cad skye ba med pa la 'jug pa'i shes rab kyis 'dus byas dang /
translated: The wisdom that does not abide in form, all concentrations and meditative absorptions, and conduct that is subsumed in the unborn limit, as well as the wisdom that engages the unborn nature of all phenomena, transcend both the conditioned and the unconditioned.

original: 'dus ma byas gnyis las shin tu 'da' ba dang / gnyen po med pa'i tshul gyis gzugs de la gang mtshan nyid gcig tu 'jug pa de ni shes rab ces bya ste /
